column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=QrQk1eFH6Iv5CIhU26YCvA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You‚Äôll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Assist with BI activities, design, functional analysis, upgrading and maintenance
Ensure the effectiveness and efficacy of the Reporting Systems, translating big data in meaningful KPIs and evidence

Be a partner for the Business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the different areas (Finance, Planning, Sales, Operation, Logistics, Merchandising, etc.)
Support users to understand their needs, translating them into technical specifications, provide assistance and training
Guarantee the congruence and correctness of data according to the company logic
Involved with SW Architecture activities related to BI
University degree in Computer Science or similar
Experience (at least two years) in a similar position within international environment of customer-oriented companies ‚Äì experience abroad will be considered as a plus
Experience in metadata architecture (logic and physics) and front-end design (multidimensional modeling facts / dimensions, reports, analytical applications)
Knowledge of Oracle Data Base and SQL PL / SqL programming languages, MS Sql Server is a plus
Good knowledge and experience of ETL tools and leading front-end BI tools
column2: knowledge of MicroStrategy. In addition knowledge of Qlik is a plus.

column1: Knowledge of the main Microsoft Office Automation tools and Operating Systems in the Microsoft environment
Ability to communicate results/customers‚Äô insight at business levels facilitating action plans definition
High level of accuracy and problem-solving skills, flexibility and used to work under pressure
Fluent in oral and written English and Italian (other languages are a plus)

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:


  • Assist with BI activities, design, functional analysis, upgrading and maintenance
  • Ensure the effectiveness and efficacy of the Reporting Systems, translating big data in meaningful KPIs and evidence
  • Data Warehouse management
  • Be a partner for the Business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the different areas (Finance, Planning, Sales, Operation, Logistics, Merchandising, etc.)
  • Support users to understand their needs, translating them into technical specifications, provide assistance and training
  • Guarantee the congruence and correctness of data according to the company logic
  • Draw up the documentation
  • Involved with SW Architecture activities related to BI


KEY REQUIREMENTS:


  • University degree in Computer Science or similar
  • Experience (at least two years) in a similar position within international environment of customer-oriented companies ‚Äì experience abroad will be considered as a plus
  • Experience in metadata architecture (logic and physics) and front-end design (multidimensional modeling facts / dimensions, reports, analytical applications)
  • Knowledge of Oracle Data Base and SQL PL / SqL programming languages, MS Sql Server is a plus
  • Good knowledge and experience of ETL tools and leading front-end BI tools

knowledge of MicroStrategy. In addition knowledge of Qlik is a plus.
  • Knowledge of the main Microsoft Office Automation tools and Operating Systems in the Microsoft environment
  • Ability to communicate results/customers‚Äô insight at business levels facilitating action plans definition
  • Customer and goals orientation
  • High level of accuracy and problem-solving skills, flexibility and used to work under pressure
  • Good time management skills
  • Fluent in oral and written English and Italian (other languages are a plus)

Azienda italiana leader della Distribuzione Moderna Organizzata (DMO), ricerca per la propria sede di Milano (MI) un/a Analista ESG ‚Äì Dati e Reporting in STAGE
Il Gruppo Finiper Canova √® alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell‚Äôanalisi e nella reportistica.
La figura si occuper√†, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilit√†.
Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunit√† di miglioramento.
Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilit√†, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilit√† dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilit√†, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilit√† all'interno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.
Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
Eccellenti capacit√† analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacit√† organizzative e di gestione documentale.
Ottime capacit√† comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.
Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilit√† o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verr√† considerata un plus.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati dell‚Äôuno e dell‚Äôaltro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunit√† professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina Linkedin (click su ""Segui"" al link https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/152414/)

4196120684,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-financial-payments-controller-at-scalapay-4196120684?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=ZjegBYwSD6RiNNyWy%2BVthA%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Financial & Payments Controller,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•
Antonio, our Head of Payments, is looking for a Data Analyst to support financial and payment operations related to Scalapay IP, our licensed payment institute.

This is not your typical analyst role: you‚Äôll have the opportunity to take full ownership of projects end-to-end, working across the entire payments and financial data lifecycle from analysis to execution. You‚Äôll operate at the intersection of people, processes, and data, playing a critical role in ensuring operational accuracy, payment integrity, SLA compliance, and risk mitigation in a regulated environment.
If you're passionate about payments and want to build deep expertise while working with cutting-edge technologies in a modern, fast-paced setting, this role is your springboard.
Reconciliation oversight: Ensure timely and accurate reconciliations across multiple workflows, maintaining data integrity and collaborating closely with the finance team.

SLA monitoring of third-party providers: Track and validate the performance of external providers (e.g., processors, acquirers, banking partners) against contractual SLAs. Ensure service levels are met, escalate deviations, and contribute to reporting for internal stakeholders and audits.

Stakeholder collaboration: Work cross-functionally with internal teams and external partners (banks, acquirers, processors) to address inquiries, optimize processes, and identify improvement opportunities.
Continuous process improvement: Collect and refine business and technical requirements to improve accuracy and streamline operations.

Risk control and issue resolution: Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate operational risks. Conduct checks on bank and acquirer integrations, manage incidents, and troubleshoot processing errors using internal tools.
Invoice reconciliation: Validate invoices from acquirers, processors, and card schemes, ensuring accuracy in charges and proper revenue attribution.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, or Technology
3 - 6 years of experience in banking, fintech, or financial services - preferably within payments, operations, or reconciliation
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Excel, with a strong data-driven mindset
Working knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or R to automate tasks and improve data workflows
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
Fluency in Italian and English, both written and spoken.
Competitive compensation tailored to your experience and skills
International environment with exciting challenges every day
Work with industry experts and tech leaders building world-class fintech products
Career acceleration with tailored mentorship and ownership of your work
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies, your creativity is welcome

Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn‚Äôt stop us from becoming a unicorn ü¶Ñ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ‚ô•

DATA ANALYST - FINANCIAL &
column2:
PAYMENTS CONTROLLER

Antonio, our Head of Payments, is looking for a Data Analyst to support financial and payment operations related to Scalapay IP, our licensed payment institute.

This is not your typical analyst role: you‚Äôll have the opportunity to take full ownership of projects end-to-end, working across the entire payments and financial data lifecycle from analysis to execution. You‚Äôll operate at the intersection of people, processes, and data, playing a critical role in ensuring operational accuracy, payment integrity, SLA compliance, and risk mitigation in a regulated environment.

If you're passionate about payments and want to build deep expertise while working with cutting-edge technologies in a modern, fast-paced setting, this role is your springboard.

What You‚Äôll Do:

  • Reconciliation oversight: Ensure timely and accurate reconciliations across multiple workflows, maintaining data integrity and collaborating closely with the finance team.
  • SLA monitoring of third-party providers: Track and validate the performance of external providers (e.g., processors, acquirers, banking partners) against contractual SLAs. Ensure service levels are met, escalate deviations, and contribute to reporting for internal stakeholders and audits.
  • Stakeholder collaboration: Work cross-functionally with internal teams and external partners (banks, acquirers, processors) to address inquiries, optimize processes, and identify improvement opportunities.
  • Continuous process improvement: Collect and refine business and technical requirements to improve accuracy and streamline operations.
  • Risk control and issue resolution: Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate operational risks. Conduct checks on bank and acquirer integrations, manage incidents, and troubleshoot processing errors using internal tools.
  • Invoice reconciliation: Validate invoices from acquirers, processors, and card schemes, ensuring accuracy in charges and proper revenue attribution.

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, or Technology
column3: • 3 - 6 years of experience in banking, fintech, or financial services - preferably within payments, operations, or reconciliation
column4: • Advanced proficiency in SQL and Excel, with a strong data-driven mindset
column5: • Working knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or R to automate tasks and improve data workflows
column6: • Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau)
column7:
• Fluency in Italian and English, both written and spoken.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=NCZ1w4h%2B6DSK0IZ6z5Pmrw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Per la nostra sede di Milano o Brescia siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Specialista Processi e Analisi di Back Office all‚Äôinterno del team Back Office Grandi Clienti Energia Elettrica. La struttura utilizza e gestisce data base relazionali a supporto delle attivit√†.

Per quale societ√†

A2A Energia. Societ√† del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella citt√†, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l‚Äôefficienza energetica e la mobilit√† elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualit√†, che risponda alle esigenze pi√π diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunit√† tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.
Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalit√† vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacit√† organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilit√†.

Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunit√† tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attivit√†

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sar√† chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attivit√†:

  • Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
  • Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
  • Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
  • Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.


Requirements

  • Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
  • Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
  • Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.


Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale

  • Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
  • Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).


Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacit√† relazionali, affidabilit√† ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalit√† vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacit√† organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilit√†.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

4194038609,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/oliver-wyman-%E2%80%93-data-analytics-analyst-senior-analyst-italy-at-oliver-wyman-4194038609?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=bpMy2XfZTlUluURsiE5Pfg%3D%3D,Oliver Wyman ‚Äì Data & Analytics - Analyst/Senior Analyst - Italy,Oliver Wyman,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.

As a member of Oliver Wyman‚Äôs Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.
Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles ‚Äì click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology ‚Äì click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company

Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you‚Äôll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.
You won‚Äôt be alone on this journey
column2: various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You‚Äôll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

column1: This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you‚Äôre excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!
Bachelor's, Master‚Äôs, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of the English and Italian language (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.‚Äã
What to expect during the interviews process?
At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment ‚Äî it‚Äôs challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case and technical interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.
If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html

Who We Are

Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate &
column2:

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.


What You Will Do


As a member of Oliver Wyman‚Äôs Data &
column3:

Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

  • Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles ‚Äì click here for more information

beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit

various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You‚Äôll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you‚Äôre excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!


Who Can Apply?

  • Bachelor's, Master‚Äôs, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
  • Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
  • Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
  • Excellent command of the English and Italian language (verbal and written)
  • Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus


How to Apply?

Please submit your CV, cover letter and transcripts. If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.‚Äã

At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment ‚Äî it‚Äôs challenging, exciting, and fun.


With a mix of conversational and case and technical interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

3629191200,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sdg-group-italy-3629191200?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=emrU0T7hfeuoCVcy2dVaVQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SDG Group Italy,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"Hai la la passione per il mondo dei dati e per la Business Intelligence? SDG ha bisogno di te per rafforzare i suoi team.
Con chi lavorerai e di cosa ti occuperai?
In SDG hai l‚Äôopportunit√† di diventare un esperto di Analytics e e di entrare a far parte di una delle societ√† pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia d‚ÄôEuropa in questo ambito.
Avrai l‚Äôoccasione di confrontarti quotidianamente con altri professionisti di diversa seniority, prendendo parte a progetti sfidanti e ambiziosi.

Partendo da un livello base, attraverso training, coaching, mentoring e un approccio never-stop-learning, avrai modo di diventare un esperto nella progettazione e sviluppo di practices con le quali far adottare ai nostri clienti un‚Äôottica data driven.

In particolare, durante il percorso in SDG, avrai modo di costruire il tuo career path personalizzato sulle base delle tue passioni e delle tue attitudini, scegliendo tra diversi percorsi, che ti porteranno in breve tempo ad essere una figura di riferimento nel mondo della business analytics.

Acquisire una conoscenza del mondo analytics a 360¬∞, scoprendo diverse modalit√† con cui possono essere trasformati e modellati i dati aziendali al fine di rappresentare i processi di business, permettendo ai clienti di massimizzare il valore ottenuto dagli strumenti analitici.

Apprendere tecniche ed abilit√† di rappresentazione ed analisi dei dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di mettere a disposizione dei clienti strumenti e soluzioni che permettano loro di prendere decisioni rapide ed intraprendere azioni ad alto impatto sull‚Äôorganizzazione
Sviluppare hard skills nell‚Äôutilizzo delle tecnologie di business intelligence e soft skills per relazionarsi con il cliente e il proprio team di lavoro
Capacit√† di muoversi e interagire in un ambiente internazionale, rapido e dinamico assumendosi gradualmente maggiori responsabilit√† e autonomia nei tasks

Technology attitude: tecnologie di Business Intelligence, Data Manipulation, Data Management sono solo il punto di partenza, ma non preoccuparti se la tua conoscenza √® a un livello base: abbiamo un Learning Center per renderti velocemente un Data Cruncher.

Business attitude: l‚Äôutilizzo dei dati e delle tecnologie non √® un esercizio fine a se stesso, ma uno strumento attraverso il quale migliorare il business dei clienti ad esempio ottimizzando il tempo degli utenti nell‚Äôoperativit√† quotidiana, oppure prendendo decisioni basate su evidenze numeriche ed oggettive. Per farlo √® necessario conoscere il mercato in cui si muovono i nostri clienti, che afferiscono a numerosi settori, tra cui: Fashion, Luxury & Retail, Financial Services & Insurance, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Consumer Products, Government, Telco & Utilities

Team player: un buon giocatore di squadra √® una persona altruista, dinamica, entusiasta, resiliente e positiva. Sono elementi alla base dei Valori SDG, e lavoriamo per far crescere una cultura dei valori a tutti i livelli.
Conoscenza lingua inglese: B1/B2 (verr√† testata in sede di colloquio)

Academy interne e centri di eccellenza qualificati con possibilit√† di ottenere certificazioni per i tools pi√π utilizzati nel campo dei big data & analytics: PowerBI, Looker, Qlik, Tableau, Microstrategy, SAP Analytics, AWS Redshift, Oracle DB, SQL Server, Azure Synapse Analytics, Google Bigquery, Snowflake etc.

Never stop learning: formazione continua per tutto l‚Äôarco della carriera con 80 ore di training iniziale e successiva attivit√† di coaching e mentoring. Valutazioni semestrali del potenziale e della performance.
Ambiente internazionale e giovane: et√† media inferiore a 30 anni, possibilit√† di trasferte anche all‚Äôestero.

CHE RUOLO TI PROPONIAMO?


Data Analyst ‚Äì Power BI / Qlik


Sei alla ricerca di un team dove poter condividere le tue idee, crescere professionalmente e mettere in pratica la tua passione per l'analisi dei dati e la Business Intelligence?

Perfetto, sei nel posto giusto!

Lavorando con noi come Data Analyst, collaborerai con un team che segue progetti internazionali e innovativi, proponendo e realizzando soluzioni di Business Intelligence con diversi strumenti, tra cui Power BI, QlikView, QlikSense e altri tool di analisi.

4191469252,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bending-spoons-4191469252?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=nx0XkDVRRJM4Cvp8GAM%2Bnw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Bending Spoons,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.
A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.

Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.

Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.

Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.

An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.

Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ‚Ç¨52,246. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.

All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we ask a lot of ourselves and one another. While this tends to lead to fantastic learning, achievements, and career growth, it also requires a significant commitment. So if you like the role and are ready to give your very best, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

We welcome applications in English and Italian. If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=Lf6nkoLp%2FVbTW4FAK%2BsLPQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e ‚ÄúCodice in materia di protezione dei dati personali‚Äù e dell‚Äôart. 13 GDPR 679/16 ‚Äì ‚ÄúRegolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali‚Äù.

MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &
column3:
Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
  • Ownership &
column4:
Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
  • Adaptability &
column5:
Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
  • Collaboration &
column6:
Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

As a world leading food company DANONE stands for international success. Around 104000 employees work on all five continents in the three Danone business areas Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition and Water on one corporate mission ‚ÄúBringing health through food to as many people as possible‚Äù.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food and healthy food needs a healthy planet this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
Do things your way. The way you work, the way you develop, the way you progress, it‚Äôs all up to you.

Working here you‚Äôll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it‚Äôs packed with opportunities. You‚Äôll work with some of the best-known brands in the world and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.
Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.
Phisycal because our offices are centrally located and easily reached by public transportation. Free water, yogurt and fruits are of course benefits for our employees.

Digital as we work for objectives, without time or space constraints, in a responsible, autonomous and flexible way that helps to reconcile life and work times, improving productivity and focusing on results.

We offer you a culture, where you‚Äôll be welcomed to bring in ideas and take initiative. You‚Äôll learn from colleagues highly committed and passionate about what they do. We believe in learning something new each day as it means you keep growing every day!
We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.
In Italy we are Certified Great Place to Work and B Corp.

Danone is committed to create and live an inclusive & diverse environment, which will drive our growth as a business, as teams, as members of communities & as individuals. Valuing diversity is recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Our aim is to ensure that all employees and applicants are given equal opportunity and that our organization is representative of our consumers and society.

We commit to foster an inclusive working environment where we celebrate all types of diversity, both visible and invisible, which includes age, race, gender, nationality, disability, background, education, religion, beliefs, thinking style, perspectives and sexual orientation.
We believe that our differences will make the difference.
In Italy from march 2023 we are Certified for Gender Equality (UNI PDR 125/22).

We are looking for a Data Analyst Assistant to join our Industrial Department in our business unit Bolton Food & Trimarine based in Italy.
You will collaborate with your manager for management of production systems and analysis of company data.
You will manage daily verification and analysis of production data via Excel and other business management systems (ex. SAP 4HANA)
You will manage customized reports according to the business needs
You will support to the Industrial Team in optimizing production processes through data analysis (plant indicators, yields, KPIs‚Ä¶etc.)
You will be responsible for verification and closing at the end of the month of the accounting and production movements
You will collaborate in the creation and updating of business procedures.

You will become part of the Industrial Team in Cermenate Plant, reporting to the Manufacturing Systems & Data Management Italy. You will collaborate with all the Industrial Team (Quality Control, HSE, Production‚Ä¶etc.).
What Makes You a Great Fit
Degree in Management Engineering, Computer science, Statistics, Business or similar
Previous experience (2/3 years) in similar role
Excellent knowledge of the Office suite and Excel
Proactivity, problem solving, excellent communication and interpersonal skills and building solid relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Remote Working: Standard business hours with remote working options available

Bolton is an Italian family-owned fast-moving consumer goods company with 10.500 people located across 60 offices, 17 production facilities, 10 R&D laboratories, and 14 fishing vessels worldwide. With a diverse portfolio of over 60 quality brands, Bolton has been enriching the lives of millions of people every day for more than 75 years, making their everyday more delicious, more enjoyable, useful, and beautiful.

Bolton Food and Tri Marine, business unit of Bolton, oversee the entire food supply chain, including managing a fleet of fishing vessels and promoting sustainable fisheries (in collaboration with WWF and OXFAM). The production is conducted through a network of 10 specialized plants globally. We offer a range of well-known brands such as Rio Mare, Saupiquet, Cuca, and Isabel, providing innovative and carefully-prepared food products enjoyed by millions of families worldwide.
Grow Your Future with Us, Apply now

4203400960,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-heritage-holdings-4203400960?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=Nz1L37jIF3FitVj25fkcDA%3D%3D&trackingId=UVKluRwILvqqT3bp1u5tzw%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,Heritage Holdings,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.

Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.
A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.
Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!
The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages
Final Interview with the Department Manager

At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.
By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.

Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

  • Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.
  • Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
  • Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.


Who We Are Looking For

  • A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
  • Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
  • An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
  • Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
  • Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
  • Fluency in English
  • Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025


What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

  • Technical Interview
  • Logic &
