<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We're seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with a strong emphasis on SharePoint administration. This role will also encompass some duties as a document controller and data protection clerk. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimising our SharePoint environment, ensuring efficient data management, and maintaining compliance with data protection regulations.
Manage and optimise the SharePoint environment to ensure efficient data management and collaboration across the organisation
Analyse business requirements, design SharePoint solutions, and provide ongoing support and maintenance
Collaborate with IT operations and IT Security to align implementation with Group IT strategy, policies, and architecture
Manage a large volume of documentation contained in multiple SharePoint sites
Provide solutions for document management needs and ensure a highly customer-centric approach.
Ensure that all day-to-day operational activities related to document management are carried out in a timely and reliable manner
Respond to and action helpdesk issues related to document management
Maintain and update documentation based on business requirements and compliance needs
Interface with business stakeholders to fulfil various data requests and ensure the smooth running of the company's Information Technology department.
Advise on appropriate data protection measures for any new types of data
Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, including GDPR
Develop and maintain data access guidelines and data classification labels
Identify all systems that process personal data and ensure processes and procedures are in place to satisfy Subject Access Request (SAR) requirements
Maintain an asset management process and ensure all IT assets are identified, registered, and physically protected from threats.
To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:
Time management & prioritisation skills - things can get a little hectic, so the ability to effectively manage yourself and your workload is critical.

Excellent communication skills (in English or/and other European languages) - you must be able to organise your thoughts in a way that others find clear and compelling. You will be expected to together well-written, grammatically correct emails and other communications. When communicating verbally ‚Äì whether over the phone, on video calls, in person or in meetings ‚Äì you will need to be articulate, warm and engaging.
Flexibility - being an effective team player means being flexible in your approach and open to getting involved with new things, even if they are not spelt out in your job description.
Intellectual Curiosity ‚Äì We are looking for someone who is truly interested in our profession and has the intellectual curiosity to delve deep into topics and bring fresh ideas into the team.
IT Literacy - you need to be comfortable with IT systems and working with data (you should have at least intermediate-level Excel).
Delivery focus ‚Äì it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters!
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Passion for our mission ‚Äòto generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy.
Our values: be a leader, build trust, be responsible, be innovative and ‚Äòbring your alpha‚Äô.
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Proven experience in SharePoint administration and data management
Strong understanding of data protection regulations, including GDPR
Experience with document management systems and processes
Knowledge of data protection and privacy legislation
Familiarity with IT support and helpdesk systems.
A busy role in a supportive team, with plenty of opportunities to learn
International scope ‚Äì we operate in over 8 countries
Competitive base salary and annual discretionary bonus.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please follow the link to apply or send your application to careers@nextenergygroup.com. If you have been shortlisted for the next stage, we will be in contact within 14 days.
By selecting ‚ÄúApply‚Äù or sending us your CV, you indicate you have read and acknowledged NextEnergy Group‚Äôs Candidate Privacy Notice.

Our approach to diversity and inclusion is a natural extension of our values. Our entrepreneurial culture inspires us to try new things, be open to different viewpoints and be bold. Our Group is committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of connectedness that values difference and gives space for individual expression. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, talent and hard work form the bedrock of who we are and who we aspire to be.

We are committed to equal employment and advancement opportunity irrespective of race, colour, ancestry, social background, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity.

THE ROLE


We're seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst with a strong emphasis on SharePoint administration. This role will also encompass some duties as a document controller and data protection clerk. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and optimising our SharePoint environment, ensuring efficient data management, and maintaining compliance with data protection regulations.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


SharePoint Administration

  • Manage and optimise the SharePoint environment to ensure efficient data management and collaboration across the organisation
  • Analyse business requirements, design SharePoint solutions, and provide ongoing support and maintenance
  • Collaborate with IT operations and IT Security to align implementation with Group IT strategy, policies, and architecture
  • Manage a large volume of documentation contained in multiple SharePoint sites
  • Provide solutions for document management needs and ensure a highly customer-centric approach.


Document Controller Duties

  • Ensure that all day-to-day operational activities related to document management are carried out in a timely and reliable manner
  • Respond to and action helpdesk issues related to document management
  • Maintain and update documentation based on business requirements and compliance needs
  • Interface with business stakeholders to fulfil various data requests and ensure the smooth running of the company's Information Technology department.


Data Protection Clerk Duties

  • Advise on appropriate data protection measures for any new types of data
  • Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, including GDPR
  • Develop and maintain data access guidelines and data classification labels
  • Identify all systems that process personal data and ensure processes and procedures are in place to satisfy Subject Access Request (SAR) requirements
  • Maintain an asset management process and ensure all IT assets are identified, registered, and physically protected from threats.


SKILLS &
column2:
COMPETENCIES


To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate:


  • Time management &
column3:
prioritisation skills - things can get a little hectic, so the ability to effectively manage yourself and your workload is critical.
  • Excellent communication skills (in English or/and other European languages) - you must be able to organise your thoughts in a way that others find clear and compelling. You will be expected to together well-written, grammatically correct emails and other communications. When communicating verbally ‚Äì whether over the phone, on video calls, in person or in meetings ‚Äì you will need to be articulate, warm and engaging.
  • Flexibility - being an effective team player means being flexible in your approach and open to getting involved with new things, even if they are not spelt out in your job description.
  • Intellectual Curiosity ‚Äì We are looking for someone who is truly interested in our profession and has the intellectual curiosity to delve deep into topics and bring fresh ideas into the team.
  • IT Literacy - you need to be comfortable with IT systems and working with data (you should have at least intermediate-level Excel).
  • Delivery focus ‚Äì it may sound obvious, but the ability to proactively churn through work at pace and deliver quality outputs really matters!
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Passion for our mission ‚Äòto generate a more sustainable future by leading the transition to clean energy.
  • Our values: be a leader, build trust, be responsible, be innovative and ‚Äòbring your alpha‚Äô.


    • EXPERIENCE &
column4:
QUALIFICATIONS


  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Proven experience in SharePoint administration and data management
  • Strong understanding of data protection regulations, including GDPR
  • Experience with document management systems and processes
  • Knowledge of data protection and privacy legislation
  • Familiarity with IT support and helpdesk systems.


WHAT WE OFFER


  • A busy role in a supportive team, with plenty of opportunities to learn
  • International scope ‚Äì we operate in over 8 countries
  • Hybrid working
  • Competitive base salary and annual discretionary bonus.


HOW TO APPLY


If you are interested in this opportunity, please follow the link to apply or send your application to careers@nextenergygroup.com. If you have been shortlisted for the next stage, we will be in contact within 14 days.

By selecting ‚ÄúApply‚Äù or sending us your CV, you indicate you have read and acknowledged NextEnergy Group‚Äôs Candidate Privacy Notice.


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION


Our approach to diversity and inclusion is a natural extension of our values. Our entrepreneurial culture inspires us to try new things, be open to different viewpoints and be bold. Our Group is committed to cultivating and preserving a culture of connectedness that values difference and gives space for individual expression. The collective sum of our individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, innovation, self-expression, talent and hard work form the bedrock of who we are and who we aspire to be.

We are committed to equal employment and advancement opportunity irrespective of race, colour, ancestry, social background, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity.

column1: Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.
üöÄ Join us as Senior Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. If you have a passion for working with data and a deep understanding of marketing campaigns, attribution, and web analytics, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.

Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments
column2:
we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Senior Data Analyst and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development, and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

  • Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
  • Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret large datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
  • Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
  • Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
  • Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
  • Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
  • Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

  • Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. If you have a passion for working with data and a deep understanding of marketing campaigns, attribution, and web analytics, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
  • Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
  • Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
  • Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

4210583791,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bottega-veneta-business-intelligence-assistant-at-bottega-veneta-4210583791?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=o25sLuRBZVti5tlLXN629A%3D%3D,BOTTEGA VENETA Business Intelligence Assistant,Bottega Veneta,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","

Inspiring individuality with innovative craftmanship since 1966, creativity lies at the heart of Bottega Veneta. Born in Vicenza, the house is rooted in Italian culture yet maintains a truly global outlook. An inclusive brand with exclusive products, Bottega Veneta is as much of a feeling as it is an aesthetic.
We are currently seeking a Business Intelligence Assistant as part of our dynamic team in Milan, with a starting temporary agency contract.
Be a partner for the business users for every BI activity, to respond in the most effective and efficient way to the business needs of the Finance and Merchandising areas
Support users in the day-by-day activities and collect the internal requests, translating them into technical specifications and provide assistance
Foster a data culture by keeping documentation up to date and provide the right education to end-users
Cooperate with Kering group for specific projects rollout.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics or a related field
Excellent knowledge of the Office suite, especially Excel
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, PowerBI and QlikSense
Experience in a similar position within international environment will be considered as a plus
PowerBI dashboard development will be considered a plus
Good knowledge of English both written and spoken
Attitude to problem solving combined with strong professional relational skills to be able to translate business needs into technical terms
Curious, open-minded and focus on team success, high attention to detail.

This is a fabulous opportunity to join the Kering adventure and to actively contribute to the development of the business by becoming part of a global Luxury Group that offers endless possibilities to learn and grow. Talent development is a managerial principle at Kering and we are committed to fostering internal mobility. Our common vision promotes leadership skills and helps every employee to reach their full potential in a stimulating and fulfilling workplace environment.

Kering is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background.¬†

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=QfEpC%2Ft6jj3Z5iir%2FQ06NQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4199463044,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-mainstreaming-4199463044?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=knS13EsB0IqXSQODag3ZYg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,MainStreaming,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment

We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.
Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.

Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2: Master's degree preferred.

column1: 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.
Execution & Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
Ownership & Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
Adaptability & Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
Collaboration & Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.
A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills

In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e ‚ÄúCodice in materia di protezione dei dati personali‚Äù e dell‚Äôart. 13 GDPR 679/16 ‚Äì ‚ÄúRegolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali‚Äù.

MainStreaming¬Æ is an intelligent media delivery company that empowers enterprises, media and gaming companies to ensure the best Quality of Experience to their audience, through its revolutionary AI-powered technology.

It optimizes the viewing experience with its Intelligent Media Deliver Platform (iMDP), the first platform designed to guarantee full governance over the streaming process, the highest Quality of Service and the best Return on Investment


Data Analyst


Job Description:


We seek a results-driven Data Analyst to spearhead our company's performance management and analytical initiatives. In this key role, you will define KPIs across the organization, develop comprehensive performance frameworks, and deliver critical insights to our C-Level leadership team through data-driven analyses and quarterly business reviews.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Define and implement Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) across all departments to drive data-informed decision-making.
  • Develop and maintain a comprehensive performance management framework to monitor company objectives, analyze current operational performance metrics, and track progress against strategic goals.
  • Perform complex cross-functional analyses by extracting, combining, and interpreting data from multiple sources to uncover actionable insights.
  • Design and deliver quarterly business review presentations for C-Level executives, highlighting performance trends, identifying areas for improvement, and recommending data-driven solutions.
  • Extract, transform, and clean data from various sources and databases to ensure data integrity and consistency for analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical frameworks.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to visualize key metrics and facilitate data-driven discussions.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or related field
column2:
Master's degree preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or similar analytical roles.
  • Experience in conducting analyses and analyzing performance data within the Content Delivery Network (CDN) or ISP industry is a plus.


    • Skills:


    • Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights.
    • Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation from various database systems.
    • Working knowledge of Python for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization (pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib).
    • Experience in designing and implementing KPIs and performance-tracking frameworks
    • Excellent data visualization skills and experience with BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
    • Fluent English and outstanding written and verbal communication abilities are required.


    Competencies:


    • Execution &
column3:
Precision: Strong attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and accuracy in financial reporting.
  • Ownership &
column4:
Accountability: Taking responsibility for work, following through on commitments, and delivering high-quality results.
  • Adaptability &
column5:
Resilience: Thriving in a fast-paced environment, responding well to change, and maintaining professionalism under pressure.
  • Collaboration &
column6:
Influence: Working effectively across teams, promoting knowledge sharing, and fostering a culture of transparency.
  • Continuous Learning: Proactively seeking opportunities to enhance financial expertise and industry knowledge.


    • What we offer:


    • A young, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment that promotes self-development and growth.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Breakfast, lunch and snacks in the office.
    • Access to E-Learning platform.
    • Health Insurance


    Salary and benefits will be assessed in relation to the candidate's experience and skills


    In MainStreaming you will be part of a dynamic, flexible, young, tight-knit and international environment and will have the chance to work in a company that values innovation, out of the box thinking, its employees and is committed to making the world a better place.

    MainStreaming is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

    I candidati interessati possono inviare un curriculum vitae con l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi del D.Lgs 196/03 e ‚ÄúCodice in materia di protezione dei dati personali‚Äù e dell‚Äôart. 13 GDPR 679/16 ‚Äì ‚ÄúRegolamento europeo sulla protezione dei dati personali‚Äù.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.
What You Will Learn During Your Intern
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive
Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
We Are Looking For Someone Who
is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern

  • Quantitative modelling of business processes
  • Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
  • Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
  • Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive

What You Need To Know

  • Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
  • Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
  • Fluent English

We Are Looking For Someone Who

  • is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
  • can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
  • proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
  • is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

fifty-five √® una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta pi√π di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,¬† supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realt√† omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
In qualit√† di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.
Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualit√† e affidabilit√†
Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media
Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente
Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore
Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics)
Sviluppare nuove opportunit√† di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto
Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda
Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.
Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.
Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT
Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics¬† (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...)

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversit√† e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parit√† di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, et√†, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. 4203400960,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-heritage-holdings-4203400960?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=ny9uG%2FFTF7gemZ0goNx0lA%3D%3D&trackingId=ifIK89NZ3tV4eZp%2FSvxBPA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,Heritage Holdings,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.

Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.
A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.
Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!
The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages
Final Interview with the Department Manager

At Heritage, we are proud to have a diverse team representing over 15 nationalities, with all communication conducted in English. We are deeply committed to providing equal opportunities and work actively to remove potential biases in our hiring process by involving a Hiring Committee in all decision-making.
By applying to this job offer, you confirm that you have read and understood Heritage's privacy policy: http://bit.ly/privacypolicy121.

Who We Are

At Heritage, we are dedicated to being at the forefront of the alternative investment industry by creating a next-generation fund that combines traditional investment sourcing and evaluation strategies with proprietary technology solutions and data-driven approaches.

Our mission is to connect elite families and entrepreneurs globally with carefully vetted top-performing private market opportunities, leveraging our digital products to make the alternative investment market more accessible, efficient, and connected. Furthermore, we embrace the principles of ""skin in the game"" as we co-invest with our partners, and ""innovation"" as we work to create lasting value through continually advancing the investment sector.

Our team comprises of a diverse international group of individuals from leading organisations and with diverse backgrounds, including private equity, venture capital, banking, software development, law, and entrepreneurship. We are committed to attracting top-notch talent and providing opportunities for growth and development based on their individual strengths and interests

Your role

About

Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive financial innovation? We‚Äôre on the hunt for energetic individuals to provide exceptional operational support and insight, helping propel our team to new heights. During your time at Heritage, you will gain exposure to a wide range of activities at the intersection of finance and technology:

  • Be a data expert ‚Äì Use your analytical mindset to work with complex data sets. Analyze daily transactions and bank statements to build clear, compelling visualizations of client net worth‚Äîincluding both public and private assets.
  • Own the account aggregation tool ‚Äì Take full ownership of the tool, ensuring the database remains accurate and efficient. Continuously identify areas for improvement and lead innovation initiatives.
  • Leverage Bloomberg ‚Äì Use Bloomberg tools to conduct deep analysis of public securities and extract actionable insights.


Who We Are Looking For

  • A fast-paced, analytical, numerical thinker who thrives in a dynamic environment
  • Committed to excellence, with a proven track record of achieving results through data-driven decision-making
  • An exceptional problem-solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Intellectually curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and skills in analytics and programming
  • Independent yet collaborative, ready to make a difference within our team
  • Ideally, you have experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Python or R
  • Fluency in English
  • Available for a 6-month internship starting in May 2025


What We Offer

A paid internship in the heart of Milan lasting six enriching months, will help shape you into a well-rounded professional. You will join an international team from 10+ nationalities whom you will interact with daily and at quarterly team-building events.

Join us for an experience that combines professional growth with a positive work environment. Your journey begins here!

Hiring Process

The Hiring Process At Heritage Includes The Following Stages

  • CV Screening
  • English and Critical Thinking Assessment
  • Cultural Fit Interview
  • Technical Interview
  • Logic &

4199415423,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/coverage-data-analysis-engineer-at-fastweb-%2B-vodafone-4199415423?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=a5VdYFqWiU9jHDJfu8K0HQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hu9zvusZma04WrC3WOneBw%3D%3D,Coverage & Data Analysis Engineer,Fastweb + Vodafone,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","CHI SIAMO
Il 31 Dicembre 2024 Swisscom, per il tramite della propria controllata Fastweb, ha finalizzato l'acquisizione di Vodafone Italia in vista di una integrazione delle due aziende.

Fastweb e Vodafone Italia da oggi lavoreranno insieme per creare un operatore convergente leader del mercato mettendo il meglio delle rispettive reti fisse e mobili e delle proprie competenze e capacit√† per offrire alle famiglie, alle aziende e al Paese servizi innovativi e a prezzi competitivi per continuare a promuovere la trasformazione in chiave digitale dell‚ÄôItalia.

Insieme lavoriamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro informale e accogliente, in cui ogni persona possa portare il proprio contributo. Mostriamo apertura e curiosit√† nello sperimentare nuove soluzioni per noi e per i nostri clienti in un clima orientato alla collaborazione e al rispetto.

Smart working, autonomia nella gestione delle attivit√† e lavoro per obiettivi. Mettiamo le relazioni e i risultati al centro e promuoviamo una cultura di empowerment e collaborazione puntando su fiducia e responsabilit√†.

In Fastweb + Vodafone possiamo coltivare il nostro talento. Ciascuna persona √® alla guida del proprio sviluppo grazie a programmi innovativi e a percorsi professionalizzanti per costruire la propria crescita.

In Fastweb + Vodafone le persone sono la nostra priorit√†. C‚Äô√® una grande attenzione al benessere fisico e psicologico e al mantenimento di un sano work life balance, oltre alla disponibilit√† di tanti servizi utili, gratuiti e innovativi per semplificare la quotidianit√† e coltivare passioni e interessi.

In Fastweb + Vodafone l‚Äôinclusione √® una scelta, che rende l‚Äôambiente positivo, dinamico e ricco di stimoli. Facciamo tesoro delle differenze perch√© caratterizzano noi, la nostra clientela e il mondo che ci circonda: dall‚Äôincontro delle nostre unicit√† nascono creativit√†, innovazione e crescita continua.
In Fastweb + Vodafone l‚Äôattenzione verso un futuro pi√π sostenibile √® un impegno quotidiano.

Contribuiamo in modo concreto e misurabile al raggiungimento degli obiettivi globali, al benessere del pianeta e della societ√†. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.

Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.
Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:
Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.
Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Power BI Developer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Je bent bekend met programmeertalen zoals SQL, DAX en Python.
Je kunt data modelleren met technieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Je bent bedreven in Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en custom visuals.
Goede kennis hebt van Azure Synapse, Data Factory en Databricks.
Vertrouwd bent met diverse soorten gegevensopslag voor gestructureerde data.
Een sterke communicator bent en goed in teamverband kunt werken.
Vloeiend bent in Nederlands en Engels.
We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶

4206093396,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-visualisation-at-norriq-financial-services-4206093396?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZAkmA57%2Firuyp0lBszibQw%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Visualisation,NORRIQ Financial Services,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.

column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
You dive into a large amount of data :
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.

Recruitment,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Mission

Generation is advancing in its Data & Analytics journey, progressively building maturity and investing in internal knowledge to strengthen capabilities in this area. As part of this transition, the Scrum Master for the Generation Use Case Team will play a pivotal role in guiding the team to deliver AI and BI use cases and data products while fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
Develop and maintain advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
Generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
Maintain close relationships with the business stakeholders and acquire detailed knowledge of the business processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
Respond to ad-hoc data requests and support day-to-day operations with timely data analysis.
Drive continuous improvement in retail processes through proactive data insights and innovations.
Present data-driven recommendations to management and aid in the decision-making process.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
Excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.
MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or equivalent experience.
Expert knowledge of SQL is required.
Expert knowledge of data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R is required
Expert knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik is required

4202456599,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-koda-staff-4202456599?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=L2RhJaGotqDvY9cmF7YEZQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Koda Staff,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst
Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.
Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.
4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).
Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.
First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst


Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English &
column2:
French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics


About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

4198440376,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/crm-data-analyst-at-nestl%C3%A9-nespresso-sa-4198440376?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=rb%2Fsq%2BtKDnp8LL5d%2FvlI8g%3D%3D,CRM Data Analyst,Nestl√© Nespresso SA,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.
A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:
In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso‚Äôs direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.
Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.
A full-time position located in Brussels.
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place
Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.
Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?
Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages
column2: if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.
