Are you ready to step up as a Data Analyst and truly make a difference?

Do you have around 3 of experience, but even more drive to grow? At darwind, we‚Äôre looking for people like you: professionals with some experience, but plenty of ambition to keep building their future.


Here, you don‚Äôt just get assigned to a project ‚Äì we work with you to shape your ideal career path based on your talents and aspirations.


What will you do?

  • You source data from diverse channels such as databases, surveys, and external datasets.
  • You ensure data accuracy and relevance by filtering and cleaning it.
  • You use statistical methods to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
  • You create reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.
  • You develop graphs, charts, and infographics to visualize data insights.
  • You work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.


Who are we looking for?

  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
  • You're fluent in SQL and comfortable scripting in Python or R.
  • You have hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau ‚Äì from exploration to storytelling.
  • You have in-depth knowledge of data modeling, relational databases, and ETL processes.
  • You bring strong analytical skills, a structured mindset, and critical thinking to the table.
  • You're experienced in statistical analysis, including regression and advanced modeling (SPSS, SAS or similar).
  • You can clearly explain complex data topics to both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
  • You're fluent in Dutch, with good command of French and English.
  • You're curious, proactive, and passionate about solving complex data challenges.
  • You don‚Äôt just identify trends ‚Äì you uncover opportunities and turn them into actionable insights.


What's in it for you?

  • Challenging projects tailored to your interests and expertise ‚Äì across industries.
  • A say in your career path, with coaching, training, and regular feedback.
  • An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, plus a mobility budget or company car with fuel card.
  • A flexible, hybrid work environment where autonomy is the norm.
  • A team that supports and inspires each other ‚Äì no egos, just impact.
  • The chance to work with data that actually gets used to drive decisions, not just reports that end up in someone‚Äôs inbox.


Ready for a fresh wind in your career? Apply today and let‚Äôs grow together!

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.
Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.
Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests
Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed
Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data
What's It Like to Work Here?
Remote-First Hybrid: Work anywhere + office access.
90-Day Work Anywhere: Work from anywhere for 90 days yearly.
Autonomy & Growth: Flexible schedules, ownership, career investment.
Customer Obsessed: Everything we do is for our clients.
Best Self Allowance: Annual stipend for personal growth.
Recharge Days: Monthly company-wide day off.
Career Growth: We invest in you.
Join us and transform retail with data-driven insights! Apply now

Job Summary:

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Data Expertise
    • Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
    • Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
  • Project Work
    • Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
    • Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
    • Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.
Skills:

  • Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests

Knowledge:

  • Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
  • Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed

Talents:

  • Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data

  • 90-Day Work Anywhere: Work from anywhere for 90 days yearly.

4206555572,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-quality-expert-at-laco-4206555572?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=t4lU3E7zXBGweavgrJOw4w%3D%3D,Data Analyst - Quality Expert,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.
As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶
You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!

As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. YOUR JOB

  • Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
  • Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
  • You have proven experience with data quality projects.

  • You know all about the SQL
  • You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.


You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶

  • You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
  • Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
  • Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER


  • Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.

  • We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
  • Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶


Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

4142330133,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-social-lab-belgium-4142330133?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=FZqfmhT4C%2F0ymPGLxDS7DA%3D%3D,Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy Social.Lab Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy

Ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by David Ogilvy 75 years ago. It builds on that rich legacy through Borderless Creativity ‚Äì innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. Ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by WARC, signifying its ability to‚ÄØdeliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities.‚ÄØOgilvy is a WPP company (NYSE: WPP). For more information, visit‚ÄØOgilvy.com, and follow us on LinkedIn,‚ÄØX,‚ÄØInstagram, and Facebook.

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels‚Äô WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices ‚Äì our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Unilever, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Lidl, Orange, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success locally & internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab‚Äù mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‚Äòsaying‚Äô, ‚Äòsharing‚Äô and ‚Äòsearching‚Äô online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Work with our clients and present the intelligence work.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
A first experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy
Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today‚Äôs social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels‚Äô codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
You understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels ‚Äì the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency ‚Äì Our words and promises produce actions.
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose - and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. Please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. Emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.

Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.

You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.
Your Profile As a Data Analyst
You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.‚ÄØ
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.‚ÄØ
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.‚ÄØ
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.‚ÄØ
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).
A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.
Vous voulez participer au succ√®s de Partenamut ?
Click on ""apply"" to access our online application form.

4211319501,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-koda-staff-4211319501?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=QM77pqX9EUh9aLv724nyzA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Koda Staff,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Freelance Data Analytical Engineer
Contract Duration: Until End of Year

Data is core to how this organization operates, not just as a backend function but as a strategic enabler across the business. The company is fully committed to data-driven decision-making, integrating analytics and AI directly into business processes and customer journeys. Their data organization works end-to-end ‚Äî from governance and architecture to experimentation and delivery ‚Äî with a clear focus on creating measurable value.

As a freelance Data Analyst, you'll be the vital link between business stakeholders and the technical teams delivering data solutions. You‚Äôll be responsible for shaping solution designs, defining data flows, and translating business questions into technical action plans. This is a hands-on role involving deep-dive data analysis, close collaboration with engineers, and responsibility for the functional integrity of data products.
Collaborate with Data Product Managers and business stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into technical specifications
Design logical data models and map out full data flows aligned with business objectives and long-term platform strategy
Perform thorough data analyses, mapping source-to-target transformations and ensuring documentation is complete and accurate
Validate and challenge proposed designs in terms of scalability, cost-efficiency, and fit-for-purpose architecture
Guide the implementation with engineers, conducting intermediate reviews and providing technical support when needed
Define user acceptance tests and quality controls (including semantic validation)
Support incident resolution as third-line support, coordinating with engineers and product managers
Monitor the impact of application changes and ensure data products are updated accordingly
Deep knowledge of Snowflake and strong SQL capabilities
Experience with orchestration tools like Dagster, Airflow, or similar
Ability to communicate insights clearly and challenge assumptions constructively in stakeholder conversations
Strong analytical thinking and a natural problem-solver

column2: understanding of Dutch is a strong advantage

column1:
Freelance Data Analytical Engineer


Location: Mechelen (2 days/week on-site)

Contract Duration: Until End of Year

Client: Leading Belgian Telecom Company


The Context

Data is core to how this organization operates, not just as a backend function but as a strategic enabler across the business. The company is fully committed to data-driven decision-making, integrating analytics and AI directly into business processes and customer journeys. Their data organization works end-to-end ‚Äî from governance and architecture to experimentation and delivery ‚Äî with a clear focus on creating measurable value.


The Role

As a freelance Data Analyst, you'll be the vital link between business stakeholders and the technical teams delivering data solutions. You‚Äôll be responsible for shaping solution designs, defining data flows, and translating business questions into technical action plans. This is a hands-on role involving deep-dive data analysis, close collaboration with engineers, and responsibility for the functional integrity of data products.


Your Key Tasks

  • Collaborate with Data Product Managers and business stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into technical specifications
  • Design logical data models and map out full data flows aligned with business objectives and long-term platform strategy
  • Perform thorough data analyses, mapping source-to-target transformations and ensuring documentation is complete and accurate
  • Validate and challenge proposed designs in terms of scalability, cost-efficiency, and fit-for-purpose architecture
  • Guide the implementation with engineers, conducting intermediate reviews and providing technical support when needed
  • Define user acceptance tests and quality controls (including semantic validation)
  • Support incident resolution as third-line support, coordinating with engineers and product managers
  • Monitor the impact of application changes and ensure data products are updated accordingly


What You Bring

  • Deep knowledge of Snowflake and strong SQL capabilities
  • Experience with orchestration tools like Dagster, Airflow, or similar
  • Ability to communicate insights clearly and challenge assumptions constructively in stakeholder conversations
  • Strong analytical thinking and a natural problem-solver
  • Fluent in English

You will work with modern data frameworks and tools to enable clean, automated, and efficient data flows supporting business-critical analytics and reporting.

Automate data workflows and orchestration using Apache Airflow
Migrate legacy pipelines from on-prem to AWS cloud environments
Perform data modeling, transformation, and reconciliation tasks
Ensure high standards in code quality, testing, and deployment
Monitor pipeline performance and improve processing efficiency
Collaborate within Agile teams and contribute to solution architecture
2‚Äì5 years of experience for medior roles, 5+ years for senior roles in data engineering or software development
Proficient in Python, PySpark, and SQL
Strong experience with Apache Spark and Apache Airflow
Solid knowledge of data modeling and data architecture principles

Agile mindset with experience working in Scrum/SAFe teams
Strong analytical thinking, autonomy, and problem-solving skills
Clear communicator and team player with a proactive attitude
Bonus: experience with Scala, JavaScript, Informatica, or NoSQL technologies (MongoDB, Cassandra, etc.)
PS: We also work with freelancers

We are looking for 4 Data Engineers (Medior / Senior) to join a dynamic data team working on large-scale transformation and migration initiatives. You will be responsible for building and maintaining scalable, high-performance data pipelines, both in on-prem and AWS cloud environments. You will work with modern data frameworks and tools to enable clean, automated, and efficient data flows supporting business-critical analytics and reporting.


Language: English (required)


What are your responsibilities?


  • Translate functional specifications into efficient technical designs
  • Develop and maintain batch and real-time data pipelines using Python and PySpark
  • Automate data workflows and orchestration using Apache Airflow
  • Migrate legacy pipelines from on-prem to AWS cloud environments
  • Perform data modeling, transformation, and reconciliation tasks
  • Ensure high standards in code quality, testing, and deployment
  • Monitor pipeline performance and improve processing efficiency
  • Collaborate within Agile teams and contribute to solution architecture
  • Support data-driven decision-making across departments


Who are we looking for?


  • 2‚Äì5 years of experience for medior roles, 5+ years for senior roles in data engineering or software development
  • Proficient in Python, PySpark, and SQL
  • Strong experience with Apache Spark and Apache Airflow
  • Solid knowledge of data modeling and data architecture principles
  • Experience working in cloud environments, especially AWS (S3, Glue, Lambda, CI/CD tools)
  • Familiar with both on-prem and cloud-based data ecosystems
  • Agile mindset with experience working in Scrum/SAFe teams
  • Strong analytical thinking, autonomy, and problem-solving skills
  • Clear communicator and team player with a proactive attitude
  • Bonus: experience with Scala, JavaScript, Informatica, or NoSQL technologies (MongoDB, Cassandra, etc.)


PS: We also work with freelancers

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Z1KqBBwtKTZVmqOsHS7KpQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô

The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

4190173326,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/game-data-analyst-at-gameplay-galaxy-4190173326?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=lsKIAjJ2VLscJWPcpixB7w%3D%3D,Game Data Analyst,Gameplay Galaxy,European Economic Area,"Department: Data

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.
All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With
You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.
What You'll Bring To The Team
At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.
Why You'll Love Working With Us
We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!

We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you‚Äôre excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With

  • You‚Äôll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
  • You‚Äôll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
  • You‚Äôll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
  • You‚Äôll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
  • You‚Äôll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
  • You‚Äôll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
  • You‚Äôll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We‚Äôre 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You‚Äôll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You‚Äôll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=c724AoqRXRpgQtUqkPlbsg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"üìÑ Type: Full-time | üìä Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let‚Äôs talk.

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence &
column2:
Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.


Your Mission:

  • Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
  • Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
  • Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
  • Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
  • Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.


What You Bring:

  • 4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
  • Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
  • Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
  • Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
  • Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
  • Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.


Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.


This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.


If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.

4023511495,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-m-f-at-littlebigcode-4023511495?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=QOwRkacR6m0WqnS%2FwO8KCg%3D%3D,Data Analyst M/F,LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch

Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!

LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).

Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience

4200130695,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/commercial-data-analyst-at-luminus-4200130695?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Ep8af7ZONV3kixFcHHBF7w%3D%3D,Commercial Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: April 3, 2025
Shape the Future of Retail with Data!

As a Commercial Data Analyst in the Retail & B2B department, you'll leverage SQL, SAS and Qlik to analyze data, uncover trends and enhance retail operations and customer experience. Your insights will be key in steering Luminus' vision.
You lead the development and maintenance of advanced data analytics models using SAS and Qlik to support business decision-making.
Gathering detailed knowledge of business processes, you maintain close relationships with business stakeholders.
You generate interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and other critical metrics.
Supporting day-to-day operations with timely data analysis, you respond to ad-hoc data requests.
You collaborate with stakeholders to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.
Through proactive data insights and innovations you drive continuous improvement in retail processes.
You hold an MSc Degree in a business/data/technology-related field or have equivalent experience.
You have expert knowledge of SQL, data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik.
You possess a strong analytical mindset with meticulous attention to detail.
You work with an agile and results-focused ethic.
You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
You have excellent communication skills in English and proficiency in Dutch/French.
The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
Insurance & social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choice: you can opt for a salay car.
Internet & communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.

Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

4207305536,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-at-geo-solutions-4207305536?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3MuQF1wDU04irOjJooYXRg%3D%3D,Data Analist,Geo Solutions,"Edegem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Vacature Ervaren Data Analist

Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.

Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.
Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:
Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis

Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z‚Äôs.
Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega‚Äôs.
Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, ‚Ä¶
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie
In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega‚Äôs. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.
Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe idee√´n: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken

Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologie√´n: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!
Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

  • You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.
  • You are a team player with a customer-centric approach and a proactive way of working.
  • You possess excellent communication skills in English and are proficient in Dutch or French.

Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

4202747264,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/impact-analyzer-at-nissan-motor-corporation-4202747264?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=h5u7Vo6v7Q24MfU0l05eAA%3D%3D,Impact Analyzer,Nissan Motor Corporation,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of ""Defy Ordinary"".
We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
How you can contribute and have an impact?
Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.
Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Fluency in English and either French or Dutch

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support our client in upgrading their current data setup and developing new data analytics methods. Your role will involve both strategic and operational tasks, contributing to the overall vision of data management and performing detailed data analysis.
Upgrade data sourcing, modelling, and analysis methods.
Develop data analytics methods to meet current and future needs
Deliver high-quality data sets and analytics outputs
Contribute to the strategic vision of OPC data management.

Utilise diverse data analytical methodologies, including machine learning and forecasting
Technical Proficiency: SQL, Python, interaction with Oracle DBs, predictive modelling (machine learning), and data visualisation (Tableau, Power BI).

Excellent communication and influencing skills, proactive attitude, strong analytical and synthesis skills, autonomy, commitment, perseverance, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multicultural environment.
educational Background: A master‚Äôs degree in data analysis, data science, or a business degree with proven experience in data analytics.

This role is perfect for a proactive and skilled Data Analyst ready to take on new challenges and drive significant changes within the data management landscape. Apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

MUST BE BASED IN BELGIUM

50% on-site in brussels, 50% remote working

Fluency in English and either French or Dutch


As a Senior Data Analyst, you will support our client in upgrading their current data setup and developing new data analytics methods. Your role will involve both strategic and operational tasks, contributing to the overall vision of data management and performing detailed data analysis.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Upgrade data sourcing, modelling, and analysis methods.
  • Develop data analytics methods to meet current and future needs
  • Deliver high-quality data sets and analytics outputs
  • Contribute to the strategic vision of OPC data management.
  • Perform data exploration, extraction, and data crunching for BI purposes
  • Utilise diverse data analytical methodologies, including machine learning and forecasting
  • Create compelling data visualisations.


Skills and Experience:

  • Technical Proficiency: SQL, Python, interaction with Oracle DBs, predictive modelling (machine learning), and data visualisation (Tableau, Power BI).
  • Preferable: Knowledge of AB Initio and familiarity with the SAS universe.
  • Mandatory: At least 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics, proven data management background, and management consulting experience
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills, proactive attitude, strong analytical and synthesis skills, autonomy, commitment, perseverance, and the ability to work in a dynamic, multicultural environment.
  • educational Background: A master‚Äôs degree in data analysis, data science, or a business degree with proven experience in data analytics.


Language Requirements:

  • Fluent in Dutch or French
  • Fluent in English


This role is perfect for a proactive and skilled Data Analyst ready to take on new challenges and drive significant changes within the data management landscape. Apply now or email Lydia.wills@church-int.com

4195833974,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-research-analyst-at-mmgy-tci-research-4195833974?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=hvD7Sejfis6F4t4kEU1Nug%3D%3D,Junior Research Analyst,MMGY TCI Research,"Brussels Region, Belgium","MMGY Global is the largest and most integrated travel marketing firm in the world specialising in travel, tourism, hospitality, culinary experiences, and entertainment. To ensure we invest our clients‚Äô budgets in ways that maximise their success, we work hard to provide the best innovative proprietary research across all destination marketing and management channels and disciplines. The MMGY Travel Intelligence division is vital to creating and sustaining the company‚Äôs sustainable competitive advantage in the travel and tourism industry.

The Junior Research Analyst role will be based in Brussels and report to a Senior Analyst. This position will also have the opportunity to work with other team members of the Travel Intelligence Group based in other locations (France, UK, US). MMGY Travel Intelligence in Brussels (TCI Research) focuses on destination intelligence and works for the most prestigious tourism destinations and travel brands in and outside Europe, using a combination of surveys and big data.
Duties and Responsibilities of the Junior Research Analyst:

Will serve as an analyst for all research projects within their assigned portfolio, including data analytics, critical thinking, and the translation of data into true insights. The Junior Research Analyst will also work closely with MMGY channel leaders to help translate insights into strategic solutions, ideas and recommendations
Will serve as the primary member for collecting, processing and controlling data, using in-house data solutions, including surveys and big data sources.
Will work closely with other data operations teams on project methodology design, data collection strategies, data tabulation quality control, and report design
Will be responsible for survey design, development, and the structure, layout, and content of client reports and deliverables using agency report templates and design standards
Will be responsible for the data visualisation in reports and dashboards.
Will provide excellent client service under a Key Account Manager‚Äôs supervision when it comes to the day-to-day communication within projects.
Will collaborate on a cross-functional basis with other MMGY teams, including tasks such as improving strategies for data collection, quality and analysis.

At MMGY Global we believe that in order to go places as a company, we must give others the opportunity to shine. We strive to create a vibrant, open, and collaborative work environment where people can be and bring their best selves to work. We are looking for an ambitious candidate with relevant experience in a similar role, or somebody looking for the next step in their career. The requirements for the role are:
A first relevant experience in market research, data analysis and reporting, trend-based tracking and analysis, or similar
Experience in statistical modelling, data analytics, and data management tools, including SPSS or similar, BI solutions (Tableau, Power BI..) and Microsoft Excel, strongly preferred
Experience in the creation, scripting, fielding, and analysis of questionnaires and survey data
Must be comfortable working autonomously ‚Äì albeit within a defined structure and with appropriate support ‚Äì and possess excellent attention to detail
Fast learner and interest in new modes of data and BI technology (social listening, dataviz, dashboards...)
Must be proactive, innovation-driven, self-motivated, adept at dealing with ambiguity, possess strong time management skills, and have excellent written and oral communication skills
Must have strong computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
Interest in the travel and/or tourism industries is a must, and experience in them is a plus
English is your native working language, and knowledge of other languages is a plus.
Benefits of working at MMGY Travel Intelligence:
A permanent contract within an attractive working environment in an international, culturally diverse, professional and motivated team.
A role with challenging assignments and responsibilities that holds real growth opportunities.
An attractive base salary in relation to your degree and competencies, as well as extra-legal benefits.

Our¬†longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow¬†amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise.¬†
For¬†30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.
With¬†11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe
At Devoteam,¬†tech is in our DNA, and it‚Äôs the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we‚Äôre ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.
If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.
For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.
As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.
#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.

Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.

Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.

Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.

Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†

Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.
