4198789186,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-science-at-technopolis-consulting-group-belgium-sprl-4198789186?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZSoFEAyNYAY3S6aqTzj3cw%3D%3D,Internship - Data Science,Technopolis Consulting Group Belgium SPRL,Antwerp Metropolitan Area,"Introduction
Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.
Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have

Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques ‚Äì not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.
The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues
Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.
For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).
Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have

  • Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
  • Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
  • Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
  • Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
  • Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques ‚Äì not just programmers.
  • Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation
column2: • Excellent communication skills in English
column3: • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

    We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&

4204360822,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/clinical-data-analyst-at-intuition-it-%E2%80%93-intuitive-technology-recruitment-4204360822?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pVhB5EOT%2FeTd7iAkCWHuBA%3D%3D,Clinical Data Analyst,Intuition IT ‚Äì Intuitive Technology Recruitment,European Union,"Title: Clinical Data Management
Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.
‚Ä¢ Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.
‚Ä¢ Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:
‚Ä¢ Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.
‚Ä¢ Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.
‚Ä¢ QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.
‚Ä¢ Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.
‚Ä¢ Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.
‚Ä¢ Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.
‚Ä¢ Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.
‚Ä¢ May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

‚Ä¢ Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.
‚Ä¢ Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.
‚Ä¢ Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.
‚Ä¢ Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.
‚Ä¢ Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.
‚Ä¢ Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections

‚Ä¢ Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.
‚Ä¢ May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.
‚Ä¢ May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools
‚Ä¢ Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.
‚Ä¢ Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.
‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

Title: Clinical Data Management

Location: Anywhere in Europe

Type: Contract

Notice period: Immediate ‚Äì 2 weeks

Must have good experience in Veeva CDM.


Job Description:


Data Review

‚Ä¢ Performs data review of clinical trial data, including query management. Communicates with study team members and CRO (Contract Research Organization) to resolve queries.

‚Ä¢ Performs detailed review of eCOA/external data per the Date Review Plan and works closely with the vendor and CRO to resolve eCOA/external data related issues. May include the following:

‚Ä¢ Acts as liaison between Customer, CRO and eCOA vendor/external data vendor.

‚Ä¢ Ensures accessibility of eCOA/external data to all relevant Customer and CRO team.

‚Ä¢ QCs a sample of data clarification requests processed by the eCOA/external data vendor.

‚Ä¢ Maintains eCOA/external data issues within the centralized study data issues log.

‚Ä¢ Ensures appropriate and timely communication of eCOA/external data related issues and resolutions to relevant Customer and CRO team.

‚Ä¢ Performs reconciliation review of eCOA/external data against EDC data and works with applicable parties to resolve queries.

‚Ä¢ Performs SAE (Serious Adverse Event) reconciliation and communicates with applicable safety team members to resolve issues.

‚Ä¢ May prepare and distribute performance metrics (e.g. site completion of data entry and resolution of queries) to applicable stakeholders. Escalates to CDM Lead and study team as needed.

‚Ä¢ Contributes to the creation and maintenance of study data cleaning plan components, including edit checks (data validation plan), listing review checks, data integration specifications, data transfer specifications, external data reconciliation plan(s), coding guidelines, SAE reconciliation guidelines, database lock plans.

‚Ä¢ Performs additional review activities for interim and final database locks as needed.


Documentation &
column2:
Filing

‚Ä¢ Files study documentation in electronic Trial Master File (eTMF) and department project files.

‚Ä¢ Performs periodic quality review of eTMF documents.

‚Ä¢ Assists with taking meeting minutes and documenting/tracking study data management activities.

‚Ä¢ Performs data archival activities.

‚Ä¢ Performs inspection readiness activities and supports CDM team during internal and regulatory inspections


Data Collection Systems

‚Ä¢ Supports the set-up and testing of study data collection tools such as EDC (electronic data capture), IRT (interactive response technology), eCOA (electronic clinical outcome assessment), ePRO (electronic patient reported outcomes), and creation/maintenance of associated documentation.

‚Ä¢ May contribute to the creation and maintenance of study eCRF Completion Guidelines and other data collection tool guidelines.

‚Ä¢ May assist with management of account access and training materials for data collection tools


Additional Activities

‚Ä¢ Assists with quality review of above activities performed by the CRO, as needed.

‚Ä¢ Coordinates and oversees the work of other data coordinators.

‚Ä¢ Mentors other data coordinators.

‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with own Learning Curricula, corporate and/or GXP requirements.

4204643972,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/sales-data-analyst-m-f-at-3m-4204643972?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=XbSD%2FekVTPS1oeUBLGNbXA%3D%3D,Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*),3M,"Diegem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Job Description
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it‚Äôs equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.
The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch¬Æ, Scotch Blue‚Ñ¢, Command‚Ñ¢, Scotch-Brite‚Ñ¢, Post-it¬Æ, 3M, Futuro‚Ñ¢, Nexcare‚Ñ¢, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.
Here, You Will Make An Impact By
Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.

Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.

Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.

Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it‚Äôs equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch¬Æ, Scotch Blue‚Ñ¢, Command‚Ñ¢, Scotch-Brite‚Ñ¢, Post-it¬Æ, 3M, Futuro‚Ñ¢, Nexcare‚Ñ¢, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By


  • Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
  • Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
  • Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
  • Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
  • Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:


  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
  • Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
  • Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:


  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
  • Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
  • Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.


Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.

Voor een langdurig project bij onze klant in Antwerpen (2 dagen onsite) zoeken wij een ervaren Data Analist die een sleutelrol speelt in het vertalen van businessbehoeften naar functionele en technische oplossingen. Deze rol biedt de mogelijkheid om op locatie te werken, vlakbij het station van Antwerpen, met de extra optie van parkeergelegenheid aangeboden door Cegeka.
Verzamelen, challengen en documenteren van de behoeften van eindgebruikers.
Vertalen van business requirements naar functionele vereisten en het beheren van de requirements gedurende het project.
Begrijpen van de bedrijfsprocessen en gebruik van applicaties om werkbare oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
Impactanalyse uitvoeren en nauw samenwerken met de Product Owner en het team om de klantuitdagingen te begrijpen.
Bewaken van de eind-tot-eind (E2E) oplossing voor een optimale businessimpact.
Analyseren van klantbehoeften en het voorstellen van de beste mogelijke oplossing.
Evalueren van IT-voordelen en kosten van voorgestelde oplossingen (bijv. licentiekosten, effort).
Organiseren van workshops en presentaties om de oplossing met de business te valideren.
Toepassen van richtlijnen en standaarden om de oplossing te waarborgen en te testen.
Opstellen van een gedetailleerde functionele analyse volgens de afgesproken standaarden.
Het waarborgen van de functionele architectuur van applicaties (bijv. datamodel).
Beheren van de applicatie-informatie en defini√´ren van de autorisatiematrix in samenwerking met andere teams.
Ontwikkelen van functionele designs en interfacespecificaties.
Vastleggen van rollen en verantwoordelijkheden binnen het applicatielandschap.
Opstellen en onderhouden van documentatie over de gekozen oplossingen en processen.
Actief deelnemen aan teamwerking en collega‚Äôs ondersteunen.
Bijdragen aan de eigen ontwikkeling en professionalisering, en die van het team.
Faciliteren van acceptatietesten en het cre√´ren van bewustwording rond kwaliteit.
Identificeren en uitvoeren van verbeteracties om processen te optimaliseren en de kwaliteit van het product of de dienst te verbeteren.
Automatiseren van testscenario's en het up-to-date houden van systeemdocumentatie.
Deelnemen aan Agile ceremonies zoals dagelijkse scrums en PI planning.
Actief bijdragen aan de teamperformance door feedback te geven en ontvangen.
Signaleren van risico‚Äôs en het naleven van het security- en risicobeheerbeleid.
Ervaring: Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Business of Functioneel Analist, bij voorkeur met een sterke focus op data en ETL-processen.
Technische Vaardigheden: Ervaring met 3NF, Data Vault, Stermodel ontwikkeling en SQL.
Communicatieve Vaardigheden: Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels.
Onafhankelijk Werken: In staat om het eigen werk te organiseren en collega‚Äôs te coachen.
Probleemoplossend: Proactief in het identificeren van oplossingen en risico‚Äôs.
Agile Mindset: Ervaring met Agile/Lean principes is een plus.
Een langdurig project bij een toonaangevende klant in Antwerpen.
Flexibiliteit om te werken in een dynamische en uitdagende werkomgeving, vlakbij het station.
Parkeergelegenheid kan verzorgd worden door Cegeka.
Aantrekkelijke voorwaarden en ruimte voor professionele groei.

4142276479,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-bi-engineer-data-analyst-%C2%A0-september-2025-at-capgemini-4142276479?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=8gdNUx6Fxsnml3Lf0ENChQ%3D%3D&trackingId=LJuyh%2B3WtDIoKQ%2BKEtiB2A%3D%3D,Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -¬† September 2025,Capgemini,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of ‚Ç¨22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.
At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!
As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.
We Are Looking For Someone Who
Owns a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Success In This Role Often Comes Down To
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
We'd love to hear from you if you‚Äôre passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.
Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:
You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
You‚Äôll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
You‚Äôll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
You‚Äôll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
You‚Äôll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
You‚Äôll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
You'll structure and leverage our clients‚Äô data to improve their businesses.
The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.
You are in the final year of your bachelor or master‚Äôs degree or your pre-final master year.
You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

Can‚Äôt wait to make an impact on the world? You‚Äôre not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.

Your journey with us

Join us and you‚Äôll be immersed in a dynamic company where you‚Äôll work with a diverse group of talented colleagues on a variety of exciting projects.

You‚Äôll be inspired and learn every day, exploring many different industries and collaborating with our clients, ranging from large national to multinational companies to non-profit and public sector organisations.

This is the field of interest for you, if you want to conduct in-depth analyses of business and technology issues, but also make recommendations to improve or transform our clients' businesses.

Depending on the team you join, you will have different kinds of tasks:

  • You'll work on interesting and challenging assignments that inspire you daily with their diversity
  • You‚Äôll assist in analysing data, helping our clients to unlock their data solutions and to drive analytical needs
  • You‚Äôll put your analytical skills into practice, improving your strong analytical mind.
  • You‚Äôll capture and translate requirements from the business as well as new existing environments.
  • You‚Äôll extract, collect, and organise data to find correlations and patterns that produce meaningful conclusions relevant to businesses.
  • You‚Äôll work with different kinds of software, data tools, and ERP systems.
  • You'll structure and leverage our clients‚Äô data to improve their businesses.

The list above is a general overview. You'll receive more information during the interviews.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You

  • You are in the final year of your bachelor or master‚Äôs degree or your pre-final master year.
  • You are highly motivated, and a reliable team player with a sense of initiative.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and have a good knowledge of English.
  • You have a critical mindset and good analytical skills.
  • You have the ability to conceptualise and articulate ideas and solutions.
  • You are results oriented.
  • You are able to use MS Office tools (Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
  • You work methodically and conscientiously.
  • You are rigorous in your daily routine, but also in your working tools and methods.

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.

Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities

Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.

Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4121947375,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-sii-group-belgium-4121947375?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=IOmolhrYAT7ciTCxAE9e2g%3D%3D&trackingId=l5PfHZF5WjKGc0QIivvwZA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,SII Group Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis
You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.
A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group
If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
  • Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
  • Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis

Qualifications:

  • You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
  • Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.

We offer:

  • A challenging and varied role in a growing company
  • Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
  • Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group

If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

4197243513,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4197243513?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=IOmolhrYAT7ciTCxAE9e2g%3D%3D&trackingId=yRKD2aeSYvGsrSgvNFqNmw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô

The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
  • Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
  • Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
  • Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.


    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
    • A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
    • Flexible working hours.
    • Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
    • Opportunities for internal mobility.
    • Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.


    Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

You have expert knowledge of SQL. You are highly skilled in data processing tools such as SAS, Python, or R.

You are agile and results-focused, with a work ethic that drives success.

4202747264,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/impact-analyzer-at-nissan-motor-corporation-4202747264?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=IOmolhrYAT7ciTCxAE9e2g%3D%3D&trackingId=pUGK1mEpZcP2aiEpGV5Ahw%3D%3D,Impact Analyzer,Nissan Motor Corporation,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of ""Defy Ordinary"".
We are now looking for an Impact Analyser to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Analytics & Innovation Director.
How you can contribute and have an impact?
Follow and measure the impact of the incubators work and ensure the sustainability aspect within the projects and activities and to record/share learnings.
Impact Measurement: Develop and implement metrics and methodologies to measure the impact of incubator projects and activities.
Sustainability Assurance: Ensure that all projects and activities within the incubator are designed and executed with sustainability in mind.
Data Collection and Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret data to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of incubator initiatives.
Reporting: Prepare detailed reports on the impact and sustainability of projects, providing insights and recommendations for improvement.
Knowledge Sharing: Record and share learnings from incubator projects with internal teams and external stakeholders to promote best practices and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with project teams, mentors, and external partners to gather feedback and ensure alignment with sustainability goals.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for enhancing the impact and sustainability of incubator activities and implement necessary changes.
Proven experience in impact measurement, sustainability management, or a related role.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Sustainability, Innovation Management, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage.
New business model design, Pricing, Market sizing.
Strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
Ability to work with diverse stakeholders and drive continuous improvement.
Detail-oriented, proactive, and passionate about sustainability and innovation.

Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
Our future vision and ambition is ""Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond"" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.

Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.

Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client‚Äôs needs.

4210904749,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-m-w-d-at-everience-germany-gmbh-4210904749?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=tAIdxX1NjQqbRvTJYfRfsA%3D%3D&trackingId=b6p9lZ3fq7x28H78%2Bh8xDw%3D%3D,Data Engineer (m/w/d),everience Germany GmbH,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Company Description
Our mission at Everience is to unleash the potential of digital technology to enable companies to focus on their value chain and increase their productivity and competitiveness.

We provide a tailor-made response to the needs of our customers to help them build an efficient working environment, adapted to the needs of users by deploying a wide range of expertise: consulting, desktop engineering, user support, knowledge management, business support, cybersecurity, cloud and infrastructure management, smart office, IT logistics
Everience operates in the Benelux and internationally and has 16 sites in Europe.
The quality of our services and the excellence of the technical expertise of our employees is our priority Everience is recruiting...
End-to-end coordination for the Epic delivery on time, on budget, and on scope.
Act as a single point of contact for the Epic in and outside the Tribe/division.
Ensure that Epic delivery is following the System Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC ‚Äì requirements/design/test/launch lifecycle) and is compliant with the associated IT controls.
Define the Cost (assessing the uncertainty level and add a contingency effort, etc ...) in the Epic investment Request.
Manage the budget and support the Epic Business Owner on Epic Benefits delivery.
Assess and manage the risks associated with the Epic delivery.
Represent and report out on the Epic throughout the entire lifecycle in steering committees. From ideation until closure.
Project manager skills, ensuring an initiative is managed within the defined and agreed boundaries (Time, Scope, and budget).
Experience in working in an Agile context, comfortable to apply Agile practice. Agile certification is a plus.
Solid understanding of the IT systems technology stack (from hardware to offering cloud services) and experience in a complex multi-tenant technical environment.
Knowledge of the specific tools is an asset: Azure DevOps Boards, ServiceNow (project, risk, resource management modules).
Stakeholder management. Ability to build a strong stakeholder relationship considering they might be in various countries all over the world (remote management).
Professional Project Manager certifications are an asset.
Knowledge of ITIL is an asset.
All our positions are open to people with disabilities

Company Description

Our mission at Everience is to unleash the potential of digital technology to enable companies to focus on their value chain and increase their productivity and competitiveness.

We provide a tailor-made response to the needs of our customers to help them build an efficient working environment, adapted to the needs of users by deploying a wide range of expertise: consulting, desktop engineering, user support, knowledge management, business support, cybersecurity, cloud and infrastructure management, smart office, IT logistics

Everience operates in the Benelux and internationally and has 16 sites in Europe.

The quality of our services and the excellence of the technical expertise of our employees is our priority Everience is recruiting...

Job Description

  • End-to-end coordination for the Epic delivery on time, on budget, and on scope.
  • Act as a single point of contact for the Epic in and outside the Tribe/division.
  • Ensure that Epic delivery is following the System Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC ‚Äì requirements/design/test/launch lifecycle) and is compliant with the associated IT controls.
  • Define the Cost (assessing the uncertainty level and add a contingency effort, etc ...) in the Epic investment Request.
  • Manage the budget and support the Epic Business Owner on Epic Benefits delivery.
  • Assess and manage the risks associated with the Epic delivery.
  • Represent and report out on the Epic throughout the entire lifecycle in steering committees. From ideation until closure.
  • The position might require traveling.

Qualifications

  • Project manager skills, ensuring an initiative is managed within the defined and agreed boundaries (Time, Scope, and budget).
  • Experience in working in an Agile context, comfortable to apply Agile practice. Agile certification is a plus.
  • Solid understanding of the IT systems technology stack (from hardware to offering cloud services) and experience in a complex multi-tenant technical environment.
  • Knowledge of the specific tools is an asset: Azure DevOps Boards, ServiceNow (project, risk, resource management modules).
  • Stakeholder management. Ability to build a strong stakeholder relationship considering they might be in various countries all over the world (remote management).
  • Professional Project Manager certifications are an asset.
  • Knowledge of ITIL is an asset.

Additional Information

All our positions are open to people with disabilities

4215388302,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solver-data-science-machine-learning-specialist-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4215388302?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=tAIdxX1NjQqbRvTJYfRfsA%3D%3D&trackingId=V%2Fc7MLMqI8cZUv3u8BSAKg%3D%3D,Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist,Exsolv√¶,"Brussels Region, Belgium","About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.
At Exsolv√¶, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.
Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.
Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.
Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.
Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

About Exsolv√¶:

We are seeking a Data Science &

Your Role:

As a Data Science &

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
  • Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
  • Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
  • Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
  • Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
  • Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
    • Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
    • Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
    • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.


    What You‚Äôll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
    • Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
    • Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.


    Technical Implementation

    • Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
    • Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.

    • Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.

    Project Management

    • Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.

    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
    • Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

d√©velopper des tableaux de bord et proposer des indicateurs cl√©s, qui permettent √† la direction de prendre des d√©cisions strat√©giques

√Ä tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos donn√©es d‚Äôidentification et vos ant√©c√©dents pourront √™tre v√©rifi√©es.

The role of a Data Engineer is highly technical and demands extensive expertise across various software development and programming domains. These professionals possess a deep understanding of data analysis, end-user requirements analysis, and business requirements analysis. This knowledge enables them to grasp business needs clearly and translate them into technical solutions. They are well-versed in physical database design principles and the system development life cycle. Additionally, they thrive in team environments.
Data Pipelines: Design, develop, construct, test, and maintain comprehensive data management and processing systems.
Data Transformation: Aggregate and transform raw data from diverse sources to meet both functional and non-functional business requirements.
Data Ingestion: Identify opportunities for data acquisition and explore innovative ways to utilize existing data.
Data Architecture & Models: Create data models to simplify system complexity, enhance efficiency, and reduce costs.
Performance Optimization & Monitoring: Automate processes, optimize data delivery, and redesign the entire architecture to boost performance.
Data Quality: Suggest improvements to enhance the quality, reliability, and efficiency of the entire system.
Data Value: Develop solutions by integrating various programming languages and tools.
Team Collaboration: As a senior member, communicate effectively and support team members by providing technical and architectural solutions.
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: HDFS, Squid, Spark, Conda, Yarn, and MapReduce
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: Flume & Sqoop, Yarn, Zookeeper
Big Data Framework / Hadoop: PIG, Hive
Machine learning (nice to have): Python & algorithms

Advanced Dax (writing dax, optimizing dax, calculation groups, ‚Ä¶)
Delivers work with high quality & precision

In this role, your primary activity will be to develop Power BI reports making use of your extensive knowledge & experience to deliver insights to customers in a UX-friendly way. We expect an advanced skillset in Power BI, not just providing solutions for customers, but also optimizing them where possible. You know how to translate business requirements in terms of analytics to lean reports and have a willingness to share your knowledge with colleagues to drive success at our customers.
Structured career progression - at Reply we encourage career growth and will give you the tools and guidance to achieve subject matter expertise and management capabilities

Business Elements is market leader in providing solutions on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, Microsoft AI, and Microsoft Power Platform in the Belgium and Luxembourg Area. With 70+ experienced consultants, we offer a broad range of expertise in Customer Engagement, Artificial Intelligence and Digital Marketing.
As a Microsoft Tier 1 Cloud Solution Partner, we also offer dedicated support services to Microsoft customers.

The Microsoft digital transformation framework is designed to enable a cloud data-centric model which is based on 4 pillars: empower people, transform products, optimize operations and engage customers. Business applications are making the bridge between the power of the MS cloud and customer's business processes. The glue which makes the magic for such strategic projects is the way a partner can map this vision to the customer reality. It is all about excellence in delivery, industry knowledge, customer care and technology expertise: the assets that Business Elements has developed during years, and that we will continue to reinforce together with the Microsoft team and our customers.

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of the data driven services of Business Elements, where we raise the standards of our industry. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We‚Äôll coach you, train you and make you part of our story.

  • R-language
  • Azure Data Factory
  • Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Develop Connectors
  • Develop Custom Visuals
  • Takes ownership of projects
