4208600849,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-application-analyst-at-euroclear-4208600849?position=5&pageNum=7&refId=lqC9P0HyThfm9pXwhcSV4w%3D%3D&trackingId=Dk9WeWML6TyP76mVpMoTFQ%3D%3D,Junior Application Analyst,Euroclear,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a natural problem-solver? Are you eager to kick-start a career in IT? Would you like to play a key role in ensuring the stability and efficiency of global financial markets?

At Euroclear, we are the financial industry's leading provider of post-trade services, headquartered in Brussels with offices in over 15 countries worldwide. We facilitate the settlement, custody, and servicing of national and cross-border securities transactions‚Äîincluding bonds, shares, derivatives, and investment funds. Simply put, we are a bank for banks, providing critical infrastructure that minimizes risk and enhances efficiency in financial transactions.

To help you make the most of your career launch, we created the IT Newbies Graduate Programme - a unique opportunity for ambitious young talents to join our dynamic international teams with dedicated support and guidance at every step.
No prior experience? No problem! We will equip you with the technical skills you need from scratch and introduce you to the exciting world of financial markets.
Ready to embark on this journey? Join us and shape the future of finance with Euroclear!

As an IT Newbie, you will join the Group Business Solutions (GBS) division, where you will undergo an intensive 3-month training program. Throughout this journey, you will be closely guided by a mentor and supported by a buddy - someone with hands-on experience in a similar role ensuring a smooth transition into your new career.

The GBS division ensures the competitiveness of Euroclear by delivering reliable and sustainable IT solutions for the financial securities markets. Our technical teams deliver new IT solutions and improve existing applications for both our internal and external clients. We deploy changes into the production environment in a controlled and structured way that doesn't compromise production stability, and we ensure applicative production support.

We are looking for Junior Mainframe Application Analysts to join our growing teams. In this role, we will equip you with a highly sought-after niche skillset, allowing you to develop and support applications on a time-critical infrastructure.

Rarely taught at universities, Mainframe technology is the backbone of global enterprises, renowned for its speed, resiliency, and security. Handling massive workloads and mission-critical applications, mainframes can process millions of transactions simultaneously while ensuring unmatched reliability and data integrity.

The best part? Skills learned on Mainframe are transferable across various technologies, opening doors to diverse career opportunities in IT. The pillars underlying the critical importance of mainframes for financial institutions and banks are the following:
High reliability and availability: Mainframes are designed to run continuously for years with minimal downtime, ensuring that financial transactions are processed promptly and securely.
Security: Mainframes have robust security features that help protect sensitive financial information from cyber threats and unauthorized access.
Scalability: Mainframes can handle heavy workloads, including large amounts of data processing and storage, making them ideal for financial transactions that require large computing resources.
Compliance: Financial institutions are subject to strict regulations and standards, and mainframes are equipped with features that help ensure compliance with these regulations.
Performance: Mainframes are optimized for high performance and can process a large number of transactions quickly, which is essential for financial organizations that handle large amounts of data.

Typically, Application Analysts join our company in the role of Software Developer. In this role, they get intensive training and support, allowing them to build up their technical, functional, and business expertise required for the Application Analyst role. After a positive evaluation, they then evolve into the role of a Junior Application Analyst.
As a Software Developer, your main tasks are:
To code, test and document the most important programs for financial markets and ensure their successful launch
Provide support to our testing and operational teams in regards to the code under your responsibility
Ensure production stability being part of the defect management and hotline
Start to produce design documentation with coaching of a senior designer
As an Application Analyst, your main tasks are:
Understand specific client needs or technical requirements. Liaise with the internal clients to better understand existing or new business processes and needs
Based on these needs, perform and document design analysis
Supervise and assess the work of programmers implementing and testing design changes
As you grow in maturity, you will take ownership of the evolution of one or more Applications in your domain
a Mathematics, Engineering, IT or Science-related degree (Bachelor, Master, PhD)
strong curiosity about IT and new technologies
ability to quickly adapt to an international and diverse company
self-learning ability (you're ready to dive into new technologies and extend your own expertise)
proficient in English (both written and spoken)
eager to work with exciting business, functional and technical concepts
customer focused and delivery oriented, with attention to details
a problem solver (you recognize underlying issues and problems, you analyse root causes and define solutions accordingly)
at ease in a fast-changing environment
What is in it for you?
Job security & career growth - A permanent employment contract with diverse opportunities to boost and expand your career through internal mobility.
Work-life balance - A flexible hybrid work setup, allowing you to split your time between home and the office.
Global & dynamic environment - Collaborate closely with inspiring colleagues from 80+ countries in an international and fast-paced setting.
Continuous learning & development - A learning-driven culture that supports your professional and personal growth through knowledge sharing, training, and reskilling.
Comprehensive support & coaching - Benefit from ongoing technical training and hands-on coaching to help you evolve in different career directions.
Attractive rewards - Enjoy a competitive compensation package, including numerous benefits, incentives, and bonus schemes.
A vibrant social experience - Beyond work, our onboarding team will help you build strong friendships and feel part of the Euroclear family through exciting community events.
At Euroclear, we believe in an ideal balance between office and remote work toward business, team and individual needs, enhancing more flexibility, trust and individual accountability.

The Euroclear group is at the heart of the global capital markets providing post-trade and related services to 90% of the world‚Äôs top banks. As a proven and resilient capital market infrastructure we

have been offering vital financial services for over 50 years. Join us and help us serve our global customer franchise as we support their settlement and asset servicing of a variety of instruments, from domestic and international bonds to equities, investment funds and more.
Great Place to Work for All

We believe that our people are our strength. The diverse talents that our employees bring to the table, are directly linked to our global success. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity, and strive to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neuro-diversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique. If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.
Join the live Q&A session on 24 April 2025 @ 12:00 CEST to find out more about Euroclear and the opportunities available.

Are you a natural problem-solver? Are you eager to kick-start a career in IT? Would you like to play a key role in ensuring the stability and efficiency of global financial markets?


At Euroclear, we are the financial industry's leading provider of post-trade services, headquartered in Brussels with offices in over 15 countries worldwide. We facilitate the settlement, custody, and servicing of national and cross-border securities transactions‚Äîincluding bonds, shares, derivatives, and investment funds. Simply put, we are a bank for banks, providing critical infrastructure that minimizes risk and enhances efficiency in financial transactions.


To help you make the most of your career launch, we created the IT Newbies Graduate Programme - a unique opportunity for ambitious young talents to join our dynamic international teams with dedicated support and guidance at every step.


No prior experience? No problem! We will equip you with the technical skills you need from scratch and introduce you to the exciting world of financial markets.


Ready to embark on this journey? Join us and shape the future of finance with Euroclear!


Division


As an IT Newbie, you will join the Group Business Solutions (GBS) division, where you will undergo an intensive 3-month training program. Throughout this journey, you will be closely guided by a mentor and supported by a buddy - someone with hands-on experience in a similar role ensuring a smooth transition into your new career.


The GBS division ensures the competitiveness of Euroclear by delivering reliable and sustainable IT solutions for the financial securities markets. Our technical teams deliver new IT solutions and improve existing applications for both our internal and external clients. We deploy changes into the production environment in a controlled and structured way that doesn't compromise production stability, and we ensure applicative production support.


We are looking for Junior Mainframe Application Analysts to join our growing teams. In this role, we will equip you with a highly sought-after niche skillset, allowing you to develop and support applications on a time-critical infrastructure.


Rarely taught at universities, Mainframe technology is the backbone of global enterprises, renowned for its speed, resiliency, and security. Handling massive workloads and mission-critical applications, mainframes can process millions of transactions simultaneously while ensuring unmatched reliability and data integrity.


The best part? Skills learned on Mainframe are transferable across various technologies, opening doors to diverse career opportunities in IT. The pillars underlying the critical importance of mainframes for financial institutions and banks are the following:


  • High reliability and availability: Mainframes are designed to run continuously for years with minimal downtime, ensuring that financial transactions are processed promptly and securely.
  • Security: Mainframes have robust security features that help protect sensitive financial information from cyber threats and unauthorized access.
  • Scalability: Mainframes can handle heavy workloads, including large amounts of data processing and storage, making them ideal for financial transactions that require large computing resources.
  • Compliance: Financial institutions are subject to strict regulations and standards, and mainframes are equipped with features that help ensure compliance with these regulations.
  • Performance: Mainframes are optimized for high performance and can process a large number of transactions quickly, which is essential for financial organizations that handle large amounts of data.


Typically, Application Analysts join our company in the role of Software Developer. In this role, they get intensive training and support, allowing them to build up their technical, functional, and business expertise required for the Application Analyst role. After a positive evaluation, they then evolve into the role of a Junior Application Analyst.


As a Software Developer, your main tasks are:


  • To code, test and document the most important programs for financial markets and ensure their successful launch
  • Provide support to our testing and operational teams in regards to the code under your responsibility
  • Ensure production stability being part of the defect management and hotline
  • Start to produce design documentation with coaching of a senior designer


As an Application Analyst, your main tasks are:


  • Understand specific client needs or technical requirements. Liaise with the internal clients to better understand existing or new business processes and needs
  • Based on these needs, perform and document design analysis
  • Supervise and assess the work of programmers implementing and testing design changes
  • As you grow in maturity, you will take ownership of the evolution of one or more Applications in your domain


Required skills


You have:


  • a Mathematics, Engineering, IT or Science-related degree (Bachelor, Master, PhD)
  • strong analytical skills
  • strong curiosity about IT and new technologies
  • interest in Finance, capital markets
  • ability to quickly adapt to an international and diverse company
  • self-learning ability (you're ready to dive into new technologies and extend your own expertise)


You are:


  • proficient in English (both written and spoken)
  • eager to work with exciting business, functional and technical concepts
  • customer focused and delivery oriented, with attention to details
  • a great teammate
  • a problem solver (you recognize underlying issues and problems, you analyse root causes and define solutions accordingly)
  • at ease in a fast-changing environment


What is in it for you?


  • Job security &

4211958959,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-medior-data-engineer-at-cgi-4211958959?position=6&pageNum=7&refId=lqC9P0HyThfm9pXwhcSV4w%3D%3D&trackingId=EDJEcsIeUFT7lvcDaviT8w%3D%3D,Junior - Medior Data Engineer,CGI,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Position Description

Are you passionate about turning raw data into valuable insights? Do you want to grow your skills in a dynamic, tech-driven environment where innovation is key? We‚Äôre looking for a motivated Data Engineer with 1 to 3 years of experience to join our team and help shape the future of data-driven solutions.
Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines.
Work with a variety of data sources and formats (structured & unstructured).
Collaborate with analysts, data scientists, and developers to ensure data accessibility and quality.
Support data warehousing, ETL processes, and integration of new data sources.
Implement best practices for data modeling, version control, and testing.
1‚Äì3 years of experience in data engineering or a similar field.
Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language (Python preferred).
Familiarity with data pipeline tools and frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Spark).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or GCP) is a plus.
A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
Curiosity, a problem-solving mindset, and eagerness to grow.
Native Dutch or French with a good English level
A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.
We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.
At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!
Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.
Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder
Join our team of experts and apply now!
Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director, Head of AI , via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.
For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com
We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.
Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role
Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.
Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Position Description

Your role in our team

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines.
  • Work with a variety of data sources and formats (structured &

  • Collaborate with analysts, data scientists, and developers to ensure data accessibility and quality.
  • Support data warehousing, ETL processes, and integration of new data sources.
  • Implement best practices for data modeling, version control, and testing.

    • How You Strengthen Our Team

    • 1‚Äì3 years of experience in data engineering or a similar field.
    • Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language (Python preferred).
    • Familiarity with data pipeline tools and frameworks (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Spark).
    • Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or GCP) is a plus.
    • A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
    • Curiosity, a problem-solving mindset, and eagerness to grow.
    • Native Dutch or French with a good English level

    A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

    Why CGI?

    CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

    We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

    At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

    Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.

    • Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
    • You work with the latest technologies.
    • An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
    • An immediate permanent contract
    • And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder

    Join our team of experts and apply now!

    Questions about the position? Ask them to Gregory Depasse, Director, Head of AI , via gregory.depasse@cgi.com.

    For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

    We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

    Your future duties and responsibilities

    Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

    Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

    Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

    You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

    Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

    You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

    Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

4201046270,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-f-m-d-80-100%25-zurich-hybrid-work-at-smg-swiss-marketplace-group-4201046270?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=TIO%2FJY5x3IsnrhyLDDkK8Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work,SMG Swiss Marketplace Group,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description
Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG
We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.
Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.
Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.
Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)
Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.
We are looking forward to getting to know you!
SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).
The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position

  • Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
  • Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
  • Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
  • Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
  • Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
  • Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools

Qualifications

What we are looking for

  • 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
  • 3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
  • Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
  • Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
  • Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
  • Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
  • Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
  • Fluency in English mandatory
  • German is a plus

Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you‚Äôll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You‚Äôll Love

  • Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
  • Hybrid work set-up
  • 40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
  • 6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
  • Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-ap√©ros, and regular company-wide events
  • Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
  • Gender-neutral fair-pay
  • 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
  • Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)

Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people‚Äôs lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance &
column2:
Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobili√®re and General Atlantic.

4208126674,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-and-reporting-analyst-at-lombard-odier-group-4208126674?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=6IV7CxZMj2N6GXItEmJwnA%3D%3D,Data and Reporting Analyst,Lombard Odier Group,"Geneva, Switzerland","A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF 300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

We report on the evolution of LOIM‚Äôs Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM‚Äôs revenue processes and implement LOIM‚Äôs transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM‚Äôs business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.
Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports
Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting
Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development
Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts
Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources
3-5 years of experience in a similar role
Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus
Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products
Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills
Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy
Team player with good communication skills
Very good written and spoken English and French

Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.
It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


    It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.

We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a ""get it done"" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Position: Senior ERP Data Analyst

Location: Geneva, Switzerland (Hybrid)


Job Description

Experience Level:

  • 7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)‚Äã
  • Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.


Preferred Industry Background:

  • Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
  • Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.


Certifications:

  • ERP certification(s) preferred


Technical Skills:

  • Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)‚Äã.
  • Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
  • Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
  • Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.
  • Skilled in process mapping and analysis ‚Äì capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.‚Äã


Soft Skills:

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills in English
column2:
other languages are an advantage.
  • Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills ‚Äì able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights‚Äã
  • A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends‚Äã
  • The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important‚Äã





    • About Us

    We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

    Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a ""get it done"" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

4202461702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-r-d-engineer-data-science-at-sulzer-services-4202461702?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=g8Ut5t%2Bt%2Fpqc%2BRhUrL7tsA%3D%3D,Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science),Sulzer Services,"Oberwinterthur, Zurich, Switzerland","CT_Technology & Innovation-E122
Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.
We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.
Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.
To Succeed In This Role, You Will Need
Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Access to a wide range of discounts
No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.
Do you have a question about the role?
Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!
Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.
We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Business Insight Analyst to join our Ancillaries & Strategy team in Chiasso. This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills and contribute to improving business performance through data-driven insights.

The candidate will be primarily involved in the Ancillaries area, focusing on pricing strategies, customer segmentation, and market behavior analysis. The role involves supporting development teams with data and insights, helping to shape product roadmaps and enhance the group‚Äôs digital assets.
The candidate will also have the opportunity to present findings to senior management, gaining valuable exposure to strategic decision-making and C-level stakeholders.
Team - you will join the Ancillaries & Strategy team within the Operations - Platform department.
Analyzing big data, determining customer trends and delivering insight to drive business performance
Closely partner with Product team, driving decision making and strategy with data and analytical insight
Executing multiple projects across teams to successfully achieve specific goals and objectives
Implementing strategies and defining models to accelerate and optimize revenue growth
1-3 years of experience in Data/Business analyst role in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience of delivering value thanks to data-driven analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel and SQL programming language
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to influence decision-makers through presentation of analysis
Familiarity with digital and e-commerce business
Previous experience in the travel industry
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you‚Äôll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O‚Äôreilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>
In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?
Then, this role is perfect for you!
In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.
We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :
You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, ‚Ä¶)
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning

Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring‚Äì you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.

Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.
Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:
Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)

P&G is one of the world‚Äôs largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash¬Æ, Gillette¬Æ, Pantene¬Æ, Oral-B¬Æ, Swiffer¬Æ, Head & Shoulders¬Æ, Braun¬Æ, Fairy¬Æ.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Reporting directly to the Data Office Advanced Analytic Manager, Guess sees the application of Advanced Analytic as a core source of competitive advantage in the data drive approach to different business areas, providing insights and efficiency to all the stakeholders.

Data Scientistinternwill be in contact with each company department and consultants' teams to follow a growth path in the advanced analytics projects and become, month after month, more independent on several tasks.

Core Job Responsibilities

  • Be aware of all the models currently in production after the knowledge transfer on each one
  • Data exploratory analysis to identify the best features to explain and describe a business need for a first internal discussion
  • Create a first draft of a prototype model to investigate the feasibility of a specific business request for a first internal discussion
  • Gap analysis on evolutive maintenance of an existing model in production to address change requests
  • Model tuning of an existing model in production to potentially enhance the results
  • Stay up to date on the data science field topics
  • Be autonomous in the preliminary analysis after the right training on the specific task


Requirements

TECH REQUIREMENTS

  • Student in Quantitative Sciences (Master Degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics or engineering)
  • Good proficiency in Python, at least NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn
  • Experience with database languages (e.g., SQL, NoSQL)
  • Familiarity in the following areas: Applied Data Science, Statistical and Machine / Deep Learning,
  • Skills in selecting the proper statistical/ML/AI tools given a problem is a plus
  • Good presentation and report writing skills is a plus
  • Familiarity with cloud environments and machine learning models is a plus


Soft Requirements

  • Curiosity and enthusiasm
  • Critical sensibility on the daily basis activity
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills to share complex technical concepts to broad audiences in simplified format
  • Strong delivery focus


Benefits

  • An International, fresh and dynamic working environment
  • Balance between work and personal life: Smart Working (Hybrid work model) and Time flexibility

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance

A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quantitative Analyst to strengthen its Trading Risk & Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
Strong grasp of derivatives pricing and risk concepts.
Proficiency in Python programming (knowledge of C++ or other languages is beneficial).
Strong ability to collaborate across different teams and functions.
Quick adaptability to new ideas and problem-solving approaches.
Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.
Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.
A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.
A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in an XVA quant role - ideally within commodities (including CVA/FVA), though experience in rates or FX will also be considered.
Proven ability to write robust, production-level code using best practices (source control, CI/CD pipelines, unit/regression testing).
Direct interaction with Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT teams.
Reports to the XVA Lead covering energy and commodity trading.

column3:
Quant Analytics Team. This role focuses on XVA pricing methodologies and supporting the development of a Quant Library, offering a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.


What You‚Äôll Need:

  • Advanced analytical and mathematical capabilities.

  • Experience in delivering optimised and well-structured code.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Designing and refining quantitative models and analytical tools.
  • Working closely with teams across the business, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology.
  • Evaluating XVA-related risks associated with new transactions.


Your Background:

  • A Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a numerical field such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Science, or Finance.

4195947186,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4195947186?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=ngsuuEiZDthr%2B0t%2BiRrVCw%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Zurich, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4192741878,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-plattform-specialist-at-swiss-post-4192741878?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=zCfpGEQALQvLQvDSKB8fcA%3D%3D&trackingId=Hb2QPGTa4tfBLhWJyIZXOw%3D%3D,Power BI Plattform Specialist,Swiss Post,Lausanne Metropolitan Area,"80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization ‚Äì with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.
As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.

You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines.‚ÄØ

As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.

You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions.‚ÄØ
You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.
You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.
Anna Rensch People & Transformation Lead ‚Äì Logistics Services Telephone +41772679069
CHF 116'400 - 131'400 Effective salary may differ from this salary range depending on experience and skills

As the driving force behind digitization, the Informatics/Technology function unit has an influence on the whole of Swiss Post and is an important partner in its success. We go beyond core IT tasks and empower the company in its digital transformation. We use the latest technologies and work to advance agile, bimodal and embedded IT innovations. We develop new, secure business models and ensure that Swiss Post has a modern, high-performing ICT infrastructure. In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. All newly built logistics centers meet the Gold sustainability standard at a minimum.

80-100 %, Lausanne und Homeoffice

Do you love data analysis, visualization and sharing your knowledge? Then join our team and make a difference! Your expertise helps us to drive digitization ‚Äì with modern BI solutions, efficient processes and robust platforms.

How You Make a Difference

  • As a Power BI Specialist, you take Swiss Post to the next level with data analysis and visualization, you bring your knowledge to the organization, and you empower staff to work with BI tools.
  • You are part of our Business Intelligence solutions team, where you develop and stabilize the BI platforms, define framework conditions and ensure compliance with processes and governance guidelines.‚ÄØ
  • As the driving force, you work with the Self-service team to steer Swiss Post's transformation into a data-driven company and empower staff through training and learning paths across the specialist units.
  • You contribute your expertise towards business analysis, consulting and the implementation of complex requirements, and you optimize BI reports and dashboards so they run smoothly and provide a basis for making data-driven decisions.‚ÄØ
  • You coordinate with stakeholders, simplify processes and improve efficiency across the units.
  • Additionally, you work closely with data scientists and data engineers, and you also coordinate and empower internal and external staff.
  • You promote exchange of knowledge within the team and ensure that requests are processed efficiently.


What You Have To Offer

  • You have a university degree in informatics or business informatics as well as several years of professional experience.
  • You have excellent knowledge of Power BI and Microsoft Fabric, including data integration, dashboard creation and scripting.
  • You have experience designing and managing complex IT landscapes, including the implementation of security and governance guidelines.
  • Your strengths include creating complex data models and transforming data from various sources.
  • Additional knowledge of other tools such as SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, BusinessObjects and AWS round off your profile.
  • Your ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders allows you to convey complex information in an intelligible way and develop solutions together.
  • As a team player, you have a good spoken and written command of German and English. Knowledge of another national language is a plus.


What We Have To Offer

  • 6 weeks' holiday
  • Parental Leave
  • Staff vouchers
  • Workation (IT)


Contact

Anna Rensch People &

In addition, we are committed to the issue of sustainability: our headquarters in Bern have been awarded two certificates for sustainability. In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification.
