MS Reinsurance is a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland with underwriting offices in Zurich, Bermuda, Miami, and New York. The Company underwrites non-life treaty reinsurance solutions on a worldwide basis through its three business units: Americas, International, and Specialty Lines. As part of the world-leading insurance group MS&AD, MS Reinsurance combines reliability and agility to make its clients‚Äô businesses stronger. With a drive to move quickly and a commitment to long term partnership, MS Reinsurance supports its partners with the momentum and stability they can build on.

In this role, you will support the Analytics team in overseeing the MS Reinsurance underwriting portfolio through the Performance Management Framework. You will analyze internal data and external market insights to assess and refine underwriting strategies across various segments, providing both challenge and support to drive informed decision-making.
Organizing and preparing analysis for annual portfolio reviews.
Assessing underwriting performance across MS Reinsurance, collaborating with key teams to identify risks and opportunities.
Researching market data to benchmark MS Re‚Äôs portfolio and refine strategy.
Monitoring key performance indicators and communicating insights to underwriting teams.
Evaluating pricing, exposure management, and business plan adherence.
Attending reserving meetings to assess loss projections and reserve adequacy.
Developing analytical tools and collaborating with the Data team for reporting consistency.
Preparing reports for executive committee meetings.
University degree in mathematics, actuarial science, or related field
Knowledge of insurance/reinsurance and actuarial principles

column2: Power BI preferred

column1: Strong analytical skills and application to (re)insurance
Effective communicator with a collaborative mindset
Ability to work independently and manage priorities
Nearly/newly qualified in actuarial studies or data science preferred
Experience in insurance, ideally reinsurance, within actuarial or analytics teams

We offer a modern workplace, an entrepreneurial culture with room for innovation and a hybrid work model. Collaboration, Empowerment and Responsibilities are key values we live on a day-to-day basis. You will be part of a hands-on culture where you really can make an impact. We place mutual trust at the forefront of our collaboration and path to growth.
Note that we will only consider applicants eligible to work in Switzerland.
In case of questions, please contact us via email: careers@msreinsurance.com

4194289103,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/trainee-artificial-intelligence-data-at-deloitte-4194289103?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=atOUDb8RuTpDXGhBL3AguA%3D%3D,Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data,Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.
How You Can Make An Impact
Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making

Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset
You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI & Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.
Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact

  • Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
  • Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
  • Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
  • Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
  • Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset


Who We Are Looking For

  • You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
  • You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
  • You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
  • You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
  • You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
  • You‚Äôre fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
  • You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines ‚Äì data management, data platforms, data analytics &
column3:
(Gen)AI
  • Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial


    • Your Team

    Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices.‚ÄØWe specialise in AI &
column4:
Data ‚Äì empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI &
column5: Data is the leading data &amp
column6:
analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit &
column7: Assurance, Tax &amp
column8: Legal, Strategy, Risk &amp
column9: Transactions Advisory, and Technology &amp
column10:
Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

  • We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

4211406084,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-quantitative-analyst-power-gas-at-vallum-associates-4211406084?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=mlrWzhUnbdlWg%2Bq66K2N6g%3D%3D&trackingId=P%2BoK3Gw5dAdAhbzjA1SnvQ%3D%3D,Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas,Vallum Associates,"Geneva, Switzerland","Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets

Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.
Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams
Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities

column2: German proficiency is a plus

column2:
Gas Markets


Location: Geneva, Switzerland


Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.


About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.


The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.


Key Responsibilities

  • Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
  • Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
  • Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
  • Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
  • Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
  • Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
  • Collaborate with research and consulting teams


Required Qualifications

  • Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
  • Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
  • Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
  • Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
  • Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
  • Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
  • Strong communication skills in English
column3:
German proficiency is a plus


What Our Client Offers


An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.


For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansj√∂rg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.

Your Responsibilities

  • Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
  • Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
  • Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
  • Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
  • Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
  • Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
  • Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.

Your profile

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
  • Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
  • Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
  • Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
  • Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
  • Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
  • Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.

Information on your application

Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.

The Quantitative Analyst is part of the Power and Gas team, delivering advanced analytics for the power and gas trading desk within Gunvor, ideally based in London. They are responsible for providing high quality insights in the products markets across the Power/Natural Gas spectrum.
In-depth expertise in evaluating and assigning value to physical assets
Assist the traders with ad hoc market analysis / insights.
Maintain and improve existing pricing models
Identify the right set of models and develops the right code / package to execute them.

Evaluate the validity of the model (both scientifically as well as from a business perspective). Maybe rephrase(?) Understand the model limitations and the difference between model output and market fundamentals
Generate trade ideas based on model outputs & Articulate insights and recommendations (based on model output) to respective key stakeholders.
Support Origination activity and investment decisions.
Communicating technical jargon in plain English to colleagues within the team.
Prepare various reports and analysis for publishing internally.
Maintain and improve teams IT capabilities.
Develop systematic trading strategies for the Power/Natural Gas Market.

The ideal candidate has strong background in quantitative skills (like statistics, mathematics, advanced computing, machine learning) and has applied those skills in solving real world problems, particularly in the power & gas business. The required expertise includes (but is not limited to):
Natural Gas Modelling: Advanced experience with different forms of Power/Natural Gas modelling: Stack, Bid Offer, Interconnector.
Applied Machine learning techniques: Good to have latest applied machine knowledge to improve models
Statistics / Mathematics: Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, distribution / probability theory.
Data Science: Time series analysis, Object Oriented Programming, Business intelligence, Databases.
Fundamental Knowledge: Good to understand the European Power/Natural Gas markets from fundamental perspective.
Between 3 and 8 years in a similar role in the Natural Gas Trading sector.
Advanced university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Science or Finance.
In depth knowledge of analytics tools and technologies: Python, R, MATLAB.
Mastery other computing language is a plus
Microsoft Office tools: excellent Excel skills (VBA).
Excellent interpersonal communication and influencing skills.
Eagerness to learn and ability to work with limited supervision.
Curious and Proactive, rigorous and meticulous.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

Job Description:

The Quantitative Analyst is part of the Power and Gas team, delivering advanced analytics for the power and gas trading desk within Gunvor, ideally based in London. They are responsible for providing high quality insights in the products markets across the Power/Natural Gas spectrum.

Main Responsibilities:

  • In-depth expertise in evaluating and assigning value to physical assets
  • Assist the traders with ad hoc market analysis / insights.
  • Maintain and improve existing pricing models
  • Identify the right set of models and develops the right code / package to execute them.
  • Evaluate the validity of the model (both scientifically as well as from a business perspective). Maybe rephrase(?) Understand the model limitations and the difference between model output and market fundamentals
  • Generate trade ideas based on model outputs &
column3:
Articulate insights and recommendations (based on model output) to respective key stakeholders.
  • Support Origination activity and investment decisions.
  • Communicating technical jargon in plain English to colleagues within the team.
  • Prepare various reports and analysis for publishing internally.
  • Maintain and improve teams IT capabilities.
  • Develop systematic trading strategies for the Power/Natural Gas Market.

column4:
gas business. The required expertise includes (but is not limited to):

  • Statistics / Mathematics: Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, distribution / probability theory.

Minimum Requirements

  • Microsoft Office tools: excellent Excel skills (VBA).

  • Strong team spirit.

About CloudWalk:

We are not just another fintech unicorn. We are a pack of dreamers, makers, and tech enthusiasts building the future of payments. With millions of happy customers and a hunger for innovation, we're now expanding our neural network - literally and metaphorically.

About The Job

The Risk Team is responsible for building the defense layer that keeps CloudWalk, its merchants, and users safe. We keep our ecosystem healthy by tracking down malicious activity and maintaining regulatory compliance, while providing the best user experience.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Create and operate fraud prevention processes, which involves daily analyses, KPIs control, automation opportunities, and customer satisfaction.

What You Need To Succeed:

  • Great SQL knowledge

4198700201,https://br.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-analytics-at-shein-4198700201?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=MBOVLd8R6jNC6MuRKQvwMQ%3D%3D&trackingId=uAgx01AIEV%2BoNpG5eRZ9Sg%3D%3D,Marketing Data Analytics,SHEIN,"S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil","ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.
We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.
We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:

- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.
- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.
- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.
Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!
- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.
- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.
- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.
- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.

At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


CAREERS AT SHEIN

We Commit to Inclusion

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.


We Engage with Global Cultures

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:


- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.

- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.

- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.



Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!



Qualifications:

- Fluent in English

- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.

- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.

- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.

- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.

- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.



At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli statistici e di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud

Sai consultare le fonti statistiche ufficiali (Istat, Eurostat, Banca d‚ÄôItalia, Fondo Monetario Internazionale, Banca Mondiale, OCSE, ecc.)
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be responsible for:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new ad hoc Statistical and Machine Learning models to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines, from data ingestion to frontend applications
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it.
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics/Mathematical Engineering, or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python, R, SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, statistical and artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation

You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly, and perhaps also in visualization of geographic data using GIS systems and/or geographic libraries (geopandas)
You have general knowledge of economic statistics (macroeconomic quantities, Istat accounting, index numbers, economic and financial time series, spatial statistics) and econometrics
You know how to consult official statistical sources (Istat, Eurostat, Bank of Italy, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, OECD, etc.)
You have basic skills with the main cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focusing on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Inside our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise. you have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management and production engineering or computer science
you have developed the capacity to combine corporate and IT expertise, as well as data modelling
you have developed aninterest in business intelligence/data analytics
you are proficient in English, preferably with study/work experience abroad

Terna, gestore della rete di trasmissione nazionale (RTN), √® impegnata nel processo di transizione ecologica e come regista del sistema elettrico e abilitatore della Twin Transition (transizione energetica e innovazione digitale), ha il compito di sviluppare una rete in grado di gestire una sempre migliore integrazione delle rinnovabili e consentire la progressiva decarbonizzazione del sistema, garantendo al contempo il costante bilanciamento tra energia prodotta e consumata.
Vuoi essere protagonista della transizione energetica e vuoi dare il tuo contributo per la costruzione del sistema energetico di domani?
Terna, √® alla ricerca di persone da inserire nel ruolo di Junior Analyst

In qualit√† di Junior Analyst, le attivit√† previste saranno di supporto all‚Äô esecuzione delle due diligence delle controparti nazionali e internazionali e contestuale supporto alle strutture aziendali interne e a quelle delle societ√† controllate, al fine di contenere i rischi derivanti da operazioni con terzi, con focalizzazione particolare sui rischi reputazionali e delle International Sanctions.
L'attivit√† viene svolta in ottica risk based con applicazione del modello di rischio delle terze parti e con l'ausilio di applicativi interni e di provider esterni in uso alla struttura.
Interfacce interne: Portale Verifica Controparti, Portale Qualficazione, VCAW, SAP, Dashboard dedicate
Interfacce esterne: Portali Cerved, Bureau Van Djik, DowJones-Factiva, Piattaforma Export Control (ECP), Telemaco, ACI, Catasto
Diploma di laurea (sia triennale che magistrale o di vecchio ordinamento) in discipline economiche (titolo preferenziale) o, in alternativa, scuola media superiore con indirizzo tecnico-economico
Buona conoscenza degli strumenti MS Office, Teams, Sharepoint, Internet e posta elettronica.
conoscenza e l'utilizzo dell'ERP aziendale SAP, nonch√© una spiccata facilit√† di apprendimento per l'utilizzo degli altri strumenti a supporto delle attivit√† aziendali.
Capacit√† di analisi dei dati e delle informazioni, conoscenza della normativa generale di rischi reputazionali (anti-corruzione, riciclaggio, 231, ecc..), capacit√† di reporting
Buona conoscenza di almeno una lingua straniera (preferibilmente inglese)
Completano il profilo: Capacit√† di relazionarsi sia con il proprio team sia con altre strutture aziendali, impegno, forte motivazione e orientamento al risultato.

Offriamo un contesto in cui le persone possano in modo efficace collaborare, essere intraprendenti e partecipare alla costruzione di un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e orientato al benessere organizzativo.

Junior Analyst


Terna, gestore della rete di trasmissione nazionale (RTN), √® impegnata nel processo di transizione ecologica e come regista del sistema elettrico e abilitatore della Twin Transition (transizione energetica e innovazione digitale), ha il compito di sviluppare una rete in grado di gestire una sempre migliore integrazione delle rinnovabili e consentire la progressiva decarbonizzazione del sistema, garantendo al contempo il costante bilanciamento tra energia prodotta e consumata.


Vuoi essere protagonista della transizione energetica e vuoi dare il tuo contributo per la costruzione del sistema energetico di domani?


Terna, √® alla ricerca di persone da inserire nel ruolo di Junior Analyst

per la sede di Roma.


In qualit√† di Junior Analyst, le attivit√† previste saranno di supporto all‚Äô esecuzione delle due diligence delle controparti nazionali e internazionali e contestuale supporto alle strutture aziendali interne e a quelle delle societ√† controllate, al fine di contenere i rischi derivanti da operazioni con terzi, con focalizzazione particolare sui rischi reputazionali e delle International Sanctions.

L'attivit√† viene svolta in ottica risk based con applicazione del modello di rischio delle terze parti e con l'ausilio di applicativi interni e di provider esterni in uso alla struttura.


Interfacce Interne / Esterne


  • Interfacce interne: Portale Verifica Controparti, Portale Qualficazione, VCAW, SAP, Dashboard dedicate
  • Interfacce esterne: Portali Cerved, Bureau Van Djik, DowJones-Factiva, Piattaforma Export Control (ECP), Telemaco, ACI, Catasto


Requisiti necessari


  • Almeno 1 anno di esperienza
  • Diploma di laurea (sia triennale che magistrale o di vecchio ordinamento) in discipline economiche (titolo preferenziale) o, in alternativa, scuola media superiore con indirizzo tecnico-economico
  • Buona conoscenza degli strumenti MS Office, Teams, Sharepoint, Internet e posta elettronica.


Requisiti preferenziali:


  • conoscenza e l'utilizzo dell'ERP aziendale SAP, nonch√© una spiccata facilit√† di apprendimento per l'utilizzo degli altri strumenti a supporto delle attivit√† aziendali.
  • Capacit√† di analisi dei dati e delle informazioni, conoscenza della normativa generale di rischi reputazionali (anti-corruzione, riciclaggio, 231, ecc..), capacit√† di reporting
  • Buona conoscenza di almeno una lingua straniera (preferibilmente inglese)


Completano il profilo: Capacit√† di relazionarsi sia con il proprio team sia con altre strutture aziendali, impegno, forte motivazione e orientamento al risultato.


Offriamo un contesto in cui le persone possano in modo efficace collaborare, essere intraprendenti e partecipare alla costruzione di un ambiente di lavoro innovativo e orientato al benessere organizzativo.


Siamo impegnati a valorizzare l'unicit√† di tutti in una comunit√† di lavoro inclusiva e a prendere in considerazione le candidature con le qualifiche richieste, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro.‚Äã Assicuriamo a tutte le nostre persone un programma di on boarding, sessioni di training mediante Terna Academy e processi di sviluppo per il miglioramento personale.


√à possibile candidarsi entro e non oltre il 05/05/2025 cliccando su ‚ÄúCandidati ora‚Äù.


Referente per la selezione: Simona Sapio - talentacquisition@terna.it


Ricordiamo che i CV inviati tramite e-mail non verranno presi in considerazione.


I candidati considerati in linea con il profilo saranno contattati nelle prossime settimane. Ringraziamo tutti gli altri che hanno inviato la propria candidatura per l‚Äôinteresse dimostrato verso il nostro Gruppo e confermiamo che la candidatura sar√† tenuta in considerazione nel caso di ulteriori future opportunit√† professionali.

4212964646,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bnl-bnp-paribas-%E2%80%93-data-analyst-%E2%80%93-portfolio-management-at-bnl-bnp-paribas-4212964646?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MspEqDAmNQZXTZqZTGyuEw%3D%3D,BNL BNP Paribas ‚Äì Data Analyst ‚Äì Portfolio Management,BNL BNP Paribas,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Ti piacerebbe lavorare come ‚ÄúData Analyst ‚Äì Portfolio Management‚Äù all‚Äôinterno della Special Credits Area di BNL?

Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas, significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in pi√π di 70 paesi con circa 199 mila collaboratori. Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all‚Äôinnovazione.
Cosa fa la struttura di Special Credits Area ‚Äì Strategic Disposals & Support ‚Äì Portfolio Management?

La Special Credits Area cura la minimizzazione della perdita attesa sulle posizioni in difficolt√† finanziaria e/o irregolari sull‚Äôintera clientela della Banca. Cura e presidia il Costo del Rischio sui crediti Non Performing e assicura il raggiungimento degli obiettivi reddituali e patrimoniali assegnati. Cura, inoltre, il deleverage degli NPL della Banca attraverso l‚Äôideazione e la realizzazione di diverse azioni possibili.
Come Data Analyst lavorerai nella struttura Portfolio Management della Special Credits Area si avr√† l‚Äôopportunit√† di:

Curare la Business Analysis del portafoglio e delle relative performance, in tutte le fasi del ciclo di vita del credito problematico. Lo farai sia attraverso l‚Äôanalisi e il monitoraggio periodico di KPI sia attraverso lo sviluppo di iniziative progettuali.

Supportare il Responsabile del Team nelle iniziative di Data Quality dell‚ÄôArea, contribuendo all‚Äôidentificazione, analisi e risoluzione di eventuali anomalie nei dati, al fine di garantirne l‚Äôaccuratezza, la coerenza e l‚Äôaffidabilit√†.

Supportare i Responsabili di Business nelle strategie di gestione dei crediti e ti occuperai della redazione di analisi dati rivolte alla Direzione per l‚Äôimplementazione e il monitoraggio della strategia sugli NPL.
Curare, inoltre, in sinergia con le diverse strutture di Business ed il Management dell‚ÄôArea i processi di budget e forecast, in raccordo con Risk Area e Finance Area.

Acquisire competenze in ambito di Business Analysis, monitoraggio dei principali KPI gestionali e di analisi quantitativa delle principali dinamiche del portafoglio NPL e del relativo piano di riduzione.

√à in possesso di una laurea in Economia e/o in ambito quantitativo (Economia, Statistica, Ingegneria. Costituisce elemento preferenziale avere conoscenze / acquisito competenze in ambito economico/statistico.
√à in possesso di una conoscenza intermedia ‚Äì avanzata in materia di:

Ha sviluppato una buona conoscenza delle piattaforme per la creazione e la gestione di database aziendali. Saranno considerati elementi preferenziali la competenza in linguaggio SQL ‚Äì DMBS relazionali (in particolare MS SQL Server) oltre che la conoscenza di sistemi di reporting di Business Intelligence ed implementazione di Dashboard.
Ha una ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e PowerPoint
Ha un buon livello di conoscenza della Lingua inglese
Ha buone conoscenze in materia di Portfolio Performance Measurement
√à in possesso di ottime capacit√† di Problem Solving
Ha preferibilmente maturato una precedente esperienza in materia di analisi dei dati (data intelligence, analisi quantitativa), di crediti strutturati e di analisi dei rischi.
Il contratto previsto √® a tempo determinato, la retribuzione segue quanto previsto dal Contratto Collettivo Nazionale del Credito.

In un mondo che cambia, la diversit√† e l‚Äôinclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunit√† di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversit√† siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.
Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunit√†)

4206918775,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analytics-insight-internship-at-procter-gamble-4206918775?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Q%2FkkvxMej7UWxaxzjrV9UQ%3D%3D,Analytics & Insight Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Location

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As an intern in Analytics and Insights, you will:
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.
Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results
Data Analytics background represents a plus
Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills
Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English
Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.
At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.
Our mission of Diversity and Inclusion is: ‚ÄúEveryone valued. Everyone included. Everyone performing at their peak‚Äù.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the ""why"" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!
Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.

Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.
Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.
Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:
Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences & training to support your professional growth.
Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!

Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!

About DataCamp

DataCamp's mission is to empower everyone with the data and AI skills essential for 21st-century success. By providing practical, engaging learning experiences, DataCamp equips learners and organizations of all sizes to harness the power of data and AI. As a trusted partner to over 14 million learners and 5,000+ companies, including 80% of the Fortune 1000, DataCamp is leading the charge in addressing the critical data and AI skills shortage.

About the role

As a (Senior) Product Data Analyst at DataCamp, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining world-class client reporting capabilities. Reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will ensure that our customers understand the value of our platform by making it easy for them to accurately track how their users are leveraging and improving their skills using DataCamp. You'll be deeply involved in working with the product and customer success teams to optimize our client reporting portal, data connectors (APIs), and internal dashboards.

You will influence changes by bringing data to the table and promoting data-driven development and decision-making. To be successful, you will need to collaborate with a strong team of software engineers, data scientists, data engineers, product managers, and customer success leaders. You will get to do all of this while leveraging DataCamp's rich data and state-of-the-art data science infrastructure.

About you

At DataCamp, we seek individuals who embody our core values of data-driven decision-making, action, transparency, ownership, and customer focus. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-performing environment and are driven by a passion for making a meaningful impact. You're adaptable, embracing change and ambiguity with enthusiasm. Your initiative and entrepreneurial spirit push you beyond just meeting targets‚Äîyou aim to understand the ""why"" behind our goals and take ownership to drive the business forward. You're a collaborative team player who values transparency and always seeks to improve and innovate. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities

  • Perform analyses on how our external and internal B2B clients use our reporting tools and services, providing improvement recommendations to the product management team.
  • Generate and maintain comprehensive internal reports and dashboards for the customer success team to monitor and identify opportunities for our clients.
  • Ensure high data quality standards by maintaining accuracy and consistency across internal dashboards and client product reporting tools.
  • Keep our internal documentation, like data dictionaries, up to date and continuously provide recommendations on existing and new metric definitions to ensure our customers can easily use and find value in the data we provide.
  • Partner with the customer success and learning solutions teams to work on key accounts by attending meetings to help gather requirements, explain our data and present insights to customers.
  • Mentor and support team members in analytics best practices, raising the analytics IQ of the customer success and product teams.

Qualifications

  • Has 3+ years of experience in product, client reporting analytics or a related field.
  • Has strong storytelling skills with a track record of presenting to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Is highly skilled in SQL and has 2+ years of experience using BI Tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.).
  • Can easily connect analytics solutions to business outcomes.
  • Has strong problem-solving skills, with an ability to come to rigorous and defensible solutions to complex and open-ended problems.
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.
  • Has a passion for DataCamp's mission of data and AI literacy.

Why Datacamp?

Joining DataCamp means becoming part of a dynamic, creative, and international start-up. Here are just a few of the reasons why you'll love being on our team:

  • Exciting challenges: Face new technical challenges daily, keeping your work engaging and rewarding.
  • Competitive compensation: We offer a competitive salary with attractive benefits.
  • Flexibility: Benefit from flexible working hours because the future is flexible!
  • Continuous learning: Access a yearly learning budget for conferences &
column2:
training to support your professional growth.
  • Global retreats: Participate in international company retreats, fostering a global team spirit.
  • Equipment: Yearly refreshment of your IT Equipment budget for your home working setup.
  • Amazing team: Collaborate with a truly exceptional team‚Äîseriously, we're awesome!

    • Our competitive compensation package offers additional benefits. On top of your salary you will also receive extra legal benefits such as best-in-class medical insurance including dental and vision. Depending on your location additional benefits might be available to you.

    At DataCamp, we value diverse experiences and perspectives. If you're excited about this role but don't meet every qualification, we still encourage you to apply. We believe skills can be developed and are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. Your unique talents and perspectives are what make our team great!

Personal and professional development - being part of one of the main VET players

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.

Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities, and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.

Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more here.

column2:

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.
