4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=qJK8K4170wPWxQ81XAE8ZA%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings

Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions
Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.

column2: can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders

column1: Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column2: ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions

column1: Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges

column1: Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.

column1: You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Senior Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data &
column2:
Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:

  • Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
  • Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
  • Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
  • Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
  • Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
  • Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
  • Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
  • Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
  • Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
  • Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
  • Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
  • Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research &
column3:
Advisory provide excellent service delivery
  • Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
  • Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

    • What you will need:

    • Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
    • Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
    • Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
    • Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
    • Demonstrate executive presence
column4:
can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
  • Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
  • Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column5:
ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
  • Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column6:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
  • Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
  • Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
  • Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
  • Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
  • Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

    • Who you are:

    • You came from a Data &
column7:
Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
  • You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
  • You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column8:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
  • You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
  • You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
  • You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
  • You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
  • You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.

    • What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?

    • You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
    • You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
    • You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
    • You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.

    Who are we?

    At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

    Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

    Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

    What makes Gartner a great place to work?

    Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

    We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

    Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

    We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

    What do we offer?

    Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

    In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

    Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

    The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

    Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

4212870347,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-for-global-p-c-pricing-team-at-allianz-4212870347?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=taRnJhbAsf9lXYeuBnVssw%3D%3D,JUNIOR DATA SCIENTIST for Global P&C Pricing Team,Allianz,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Global P&C is an Allianz SE department established in 2011 as continuation of the Center of Competence project started in 2005. Its mission is supporting all Allianz P&C Entities to be outstanding in technical excellence by leveraging Allianz Capabilities.

Global P&C Pricing team is responsible for identifying, supporting implementation and ensuring standards, best practices and guidelines for data management, tariff development, portfolio analysis and monitoring. Specifically, the team oversees:

Joint projects with the Allianz local entities around the world: we collaborate with local entities on pricing projects concerning mainly technical pricing, behavioural models, price optimization, scenario analysis, development of pricing and portfolio management tools.
Research and development on Data & Analytics and tools to enhance the level of sophistication always considering the business relevance and impact
Knowledge sharing and training of best practices: we design and facilitate P&C Pricing Academy courses to the wide community of pricing analyst of Allianz Group.

Review activities: periodically we review the full pricing process of each local entity to ensure the standardization and harmonization of pricing processes and the implementation of best practices across the group.
Support the data ingestion, transformation, cleaning and exploration procedures
Structuring data science solutions to achieve a given set of business objectives
Build and prototype analysis and Machine Learning models and support their implementation and deployment in the systems of the company
Model customer‚Äôs behavior based on market and competitor‚Äôs analysis
Implement and enhance dashboards and business intelligence tools to support risk analysis and portfolio management
Doing Research and Development to find new technical solutions
Summarize, design and communicate effectively the results to both internal and external stakeholders
Act as teacher for internal Pricing Academy courses
PhD or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Engineering)
Fluent in Italian and English, written and spoken
Valued international experience in both academic and professional settings
Experience with Pandas or SQL for data manipulation and analysis
Familiarity with machine learning techniques like gradient boosting machines and linear models
Experience with PySpark for large-scale data processing would be an advantage
Passionate and skilled in data analysis and statistical modelling to support strategic decisions
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a diverse, multicultural and multidisciplinary team

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.
Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.
Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

Iconsulting √® alla ricerca di talentuosi neolaureati da inserire nei team di progetto con il ruolo di Junior Data Engineer.

Entrando a far parte della nostra squadra, avrai l'opportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con un team di esperti su progetti innovativi e tecnicamente avanzati nell'ambito dati, con l‚Äôobiettivo di aiutare i clienti a sviluppare le loro strategie IT.

Al tuo ingresso in Azienda riceverai una formazione strutturata e sarai supportato da un tutor dedicato che ti guider√† nell'apprendimento delle principali tecnologie di mercato e ti aiuter√† a sviluppare le competenze necessarie.
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria Informatica o Informatica
Esperienza pratica con database relazionali e competenza nell'utilizzo di SQL
Una buona conoscenza dei linguaggi Python e Java
Conoscenza preferenziale in ambito Data integration e Database (Relazionali es. MySql)
Interesse per le tecnologie NoSQL e Big Data
Preferibile familiarit√† con strumenti di Data Visualization come Tableau, Power BI o Qlik

Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

    Cosa offriamo ai candidati?

    Ai candidati selezionati verr√† offerto un percorso di sviluppo di carriera e crescita strutturato per obiettivi, con processi formativi sia in ambito tech sia in ambito soft skills.

    Nel pacchetto retributivo sono compresi assicurazione medica integrativa, buoni pasto, welfare e convenzioni dipendenti usufruibili su tutto il territorio nazionale, dotazioni integrative per lo smart working.

    Sede di lavoro: Roma o Napoli. E' previsto lo smart working.

4214581648,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-0-experience-required-at-peroptyx-4214581648?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=izPSO4BWLCjSghNDrdAf7g%3D%3D,Data Analyst (0 Experience Required),Peroptyx,"Rome, Latium, Italy","For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.

As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.

With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.
So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!
Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Italian.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Italy.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Italy for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.

4210903604,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/clinical-monitoring-analyst-cma-at-iqvia-4210903604?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=EexZUCePy2yYxKzYW%2BgACw%3D%3D,Clinical Monitoring Analyst (CMA),IQVIA,"Rome, Latium, Italy","This unique role within IQVIA lends itself to a Lead programmer on Cluepoints called Centralized Monitoring Analyst (CMA) with strong communication and organisation skills. Having experience with SAS programming is necessary. The role can be based remotely from numerous European countries or South Africa.
This role is part of a sponsor dedicated project where you will be working with the client directly to manage deliveries.

The CMA contributes to the execution of the Centralized Monitoring process by performing the setup, programming and refresh(es) of the Centralized Monitoring platform, according to the study-specific Centralized Monitoring Plan (CMP).

Supports the Centralized Monitoring Lead (CML) in the development of the fit-for purpose CM strategy by contributing to the identification of the relevant CM elements to be implemented for the study (Quality Tolerance Limits (QTL), Key Risk Indicators, data visualizations and Data Quality Assessments)
Setup/Program QTL, KRI and Data Quality Assessments according to the study CMP
Refresh the Centralized Monitoring Platform at predefined frequency to enable signal identification
Generate and maintain the Centralized Monitoring Platform specifications document and file it in eTMF
Review and understanding of protocol is key
Understand the data sources for the study, the data transfer specifications and the data structure
Execute and document peer-review of CM platform setup done by other CMA colleagues
At least 3 years relevant experience in the area of pharmaceutical research and development or related field preferably in centralized Monitoring, data management, and/or biostatistics
2-3 years SAS experience preferred including macro language
Ability to work in an autonomous way and engage with relevant stakeholders to execute activities related to study level centralized monitoring process.
Ability to understand basic statistical analysis concepts and to interpret their outcome.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information during interactions with staff at all levels
Ability to work with limited close supervision.
Demonstrated communication, interpersonal, organizational and problem-solving skills
High levels of initiative, drive and commitment.
Prior experience in a Data Management related field is required
Experience with relational databases, preferably Clinical Data Management and EDC Systems
Experience communicating with all levels of personnel and participating in collaborative work team (locally and globally).
Advanced knowledge of federal regulations, Good Clinical Practice, and Good Clinical Data Management Practices.
Excellent command, both verbal and written, of English

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

This unique role within IQVIA lends itself to a Lead programmer on Cluepoints called Centralized Monitoring Analyst (CMA) with strong communication and organisation skills. Having experience with SAS programming is necessary. The role can be based remotely from numerous European countries or South Africa.

This role is part of a sponsor dedicated project where you will be working with the client directly to manage deliveries.

The CMA contributes to the execution of the Centralized Monitoring process by performing the setup, programming and refresh(es) of the Centralized Monitoring platform, according to the study-specific Centralized Monitoring Plan (CMP).

Main responsibilities include:


  • Supports the Centralized Monitoring Lead (CML) in the development of the fit-for purpose CM strategy by contributing to the identification of the relevant CM elements to be implemented for the study (Quality Tolerance Limits (QTL), Key Risk Indicators, data visualizations and Data Quality Assessments)
  • Setup/Program QTL, KRI and Data Quality Assessments according to the study CMP
  • Refresh the Centralized Monitoring Platform at predefined frequency to enable signal identification
  • Generate and maintain the Centralized Monitoring Platform specifications document and file it in eTMF
  • Review and understanding of protocol is key
  • Understand the data sources for the study, the data transfer specifications and the data structure
  • Execute and document peer-review of CM platform setup done by other CMA colleagues

Experience:


  • At least 3 years relevant experience in the area of pharmaceutical research and development or related field preferably in centralized Monitoring, data management, and/or biostatistics
  • 2-3 years SAS experience preferred including macro language
  • Ability to work in an autonomous way and engage with relevant stakeholders to execute activities related to study level centralized monitoring process.
  • Ability to understand basic statistical analysis concepts and to interpret their outcome.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information during interactions with staff at all levels
  • Ability to work with limited close supervision.
  • Demonstrated communication, interpersonal, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • High levels of initiative, drive and commitment.
  • Prior experience in a Data Management related field is required
  • Experience with relational databases, preferably Clinical Data Management and EDC Systems
  • Experience communicating with all levels of personnel and participating in collaborative work team (locally and globally).
  • Advanced knowledge of federal regulations, Good Clinical Practice, and Good Clinical Data Management Practices.
  • Excellent command, both verbal and written, of English

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

4187475253,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-ai-consultant-senior-consultant-roma-at-pwc-italy-4187475253?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=FaACH8q0GQATbpVM6fc7Yw%3D%3D,Data & AI Consultant | Senior Consultant - Roma,PwC Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","At PwC, our people in data and analytics focus on leveraging data to drive insights and make informed business decisions. They utilise advanced analytics techniques to help clients optimise their operations and achieve their strategic goals. In business intelligence at PwC, you will focus on leveraging data and analytics to provide strategic insights and drive informed decision-making for clients. You will develop and implement innovative solutions to optimise business performance and enhance competitive advantage.

Focused on relationships, you are building meaningful client connections, and learning how to manage and inspire others. Navigating increasingly complex situations, you are growing your personal brand, deepening technical expertise and awareness of your strengths. You are expected to anticipate the needs of your teams and clients, and to deliver quality. Embracing increased ambiguity, you are comfortable when the path forward isn‚Äôt clear, you ask questions, and you use these moments as opportunities to grow.
Examples of the skills, knowledge, and experiences you need to lead and deliver value at this level include but are not limited to:
Respond effectively to the diverse perspectives, needs, and feelings of others.
Use a broad range of tools, methodologies and techniques to generate new ideas and solve problems.
Use critical thinking to break down complex concepts.
Understand the broader objectives of your project or role and how your work fits into the overall strategy.
Develop a deeper understanding of the business context and how it is changing.
Use reflection to develop self awareness, enhance strengths and address development areas.
Interpret data to inform insights and recommendations.
Uphold and reinforce professional and technical standards (e.g. refer to specific PwC tax and audit guidance), the Firm's code of conduct, and independence requirements.

Il Gruppo EIES rappresenta l'alleanza strategica di quattro aziende italiane leader nel settore informatico, unite per offrire al mercato una copertura completa, integrata e sinergica.

Composto da Energent, I&M Consulting, Enway e Skienda, il Gruppo √® una realt√† che eroga consulenza, progettualit√† e servizi in ambito ICT, fornendo soluzioni ad alto valore aggiunto per i propri clienti. Con sedi a Roma, Napoli e Milano, operiamo in settori come Finance, Insurance, Telco, Energy e Pubblica Amministrazione, collaborando con aziende di primaria importanza ed i principali System Integrator.

Il gruppo √® organizzato in practices tematiche afferenti a diverse aree di competenza: Infrastrutture & Security, Application Modernization & Cloud Transformation, Data Science e Artificial Intelligence e Consulting. Inoltre, il Gruppo dispone di due Factory specializzate in Sviluppo Software e Dati che lavorano sinergicamente per progettare soluzioni innovative, affidabili e personalizzate e per la delivery di progetti chiavi in mano.

Unirsi al Gruppo EIES significa entrare a far parte di una realt√† dinamica e all'avanguardia, dove il contributo di ciascuno viene valorizzato e l'innovazione √® al centro di ci√≤ che facciamo. Se cerchi una sfida stimolante in un ambiente in continua evoluzione, il nostro gruppo √® il posto giusto per te.

4157911762,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-it-officer-and-business-analyst-based-at-our-luxembourg-at-european-investment-bank-eib-4157911762?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=COaUsV7ooA3aW5FQUCAP%2BA%3D%3D,(Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst - based at our Luxembourg,European Investment Bank (EIB),"Rome, Latium, Italy","This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ‚Äì Coordination Division (COORD) ‚Äì at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications
Panel interviews are forseen as of March 2025.

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate‚Äôs intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data governance and data quality frameworks.

You will report to and work under the supervision of the Head of Division of JU Coordination. You will work closely with the senior management team of the Legal Directorate, JU divisions and various other counterparts. You will cooperate with central IT Services with other Data Officers and with external consultants.
Contribute to the development and deployment of new IT applications in the Legal Directorate to ensure broad-based, timely and efficient take up of new technologies
Provide support to internal clients concerning existing IT applications used by the Legal Directorate
Develop, deploy and provide ongoing support for the intranet presence of the Legal Directorate
Find new use cases for existing or new IT applications, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank

Perform the role of JU Data Officer by: (i) taking the lead in matters related to compliance with EIBG‚Äôs data governance, data management and data quality framework, (ii) identifying and remedying data governance issues adversely affecting the functioning of the Legal Directorate
column2: and (iii) participating in meetings of the Information Governance Steering Committee and analogous bodies to represent the interests of the Legal Directorate

column1: Contribute to streamlining of JU internal processes and map, standardize, control, and automate legal workflows, documents, templates, and electronic records
Provide change management support to IT, Legal Tech & Innovation projects in the Legal Directorate
University degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science/Engineering and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in a role related to IT engineering and/or innovation
Familiarity with the SDLC (software development lifecycle), ideally at the EIBG or other relevant organization, is required
Business analysis and change management experience would be a strong asset
Knowledge of all or most of the following: Microsoft Sharepoint online, Business Object, Microsoft 365, OpenText Livelink, Smart-IT is required
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the EIB ‚Äôs mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*) with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage
Find out more about EIB core competencies here
To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ‚Äì Coordination Division (COORD) ‚Äì at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst* - This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.

  • internal benchmark (Associate) Officer Business Support for IT Applications

Purpose

This role is based in the Coordination Division of the Legal Directorate. As an (Associate) IT Officer and Business Analyst, you will work in coordination with a Senior Legal Engineering and Innovation Officer to: (i) co-ordinate the prospecting of new applications suitable for the Legal Directorate, (ii) ensure maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate, (iii) liaise with stakeholders in the Legal Directorate to ensure close alignment with business needs, and (iv) contribute to successful IT project delivery and change management. You will also contribute to the development and maintenance of the Legal Directorate‚Äôs intranet presence and to compliance with the Bank‚Äôs data governance and data quality frameworks.

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

4194675434,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-centers-expert-gartner-analyst-remote-emea-at-gartner-4194675434?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=2RuwKnB0fng3GHSwudP2fQ%3D%3D&trackingId=YmpirBCuICBG9nHUAIu1dA%3D%3D,"Data Centers Expert, Gartner Analyst, Remote EMEA",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.
Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.

Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&O events.
Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.
Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

As a Director Analyst specializing in Cloud and Data Centers at Gartner, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital infrastructure by providing strategic advice to CIOs and IT leaders on infrastructure, operations, and cloud strategies. With a focus on emerging technologies and trends, you will deliver actionable insights and thought leadership to our clients. Your expertise will be sought after for keynote speaking engagements and advisory roles across various sectors, including enterprises, governments, and technology providers.

Location: United Kingdom

Position Type: Full-time

What You Will Do:

  • Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on data center trends, technologies, and strategies. Key areas of focus can include:
  • Colocation and Datacenters: Explore trends and strategies in colocation services and data center management.
  • Hybrid Cloud and Multicloud Strategies: Provide insights into hybrid and multicloud environments, including cloud lock-in, portability, and cloud operating models.
  • Cloud Hyperscalers and Specialty Providers: Analyze the offerings and strategies of major cloud hyperscalers and specialty cloud providers.
  • Data Center Transformation and Consolidation: Offer strategies for transforming and consolidating data center operations to enhance efficiency and sustainability.
  • Edge Computing and Future Data Infrastructure: Examine the role of edge computing in modern data infrastructure and its integration with cloud services.
  • Resilience and Disaster Recovery: Develop strategies for cloud resilience, disaster recovery, and backup solutions, including hyperconverged and integrated systems.
  • Industry Insight: Offer expert guidance on cloud strategies and the future of data centers, advising executives in large and small enterprises, investors, and service providers.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop in-depth research and analysis that addresses the needs of IT leaders and decision-makers.
  • Client Advisory: Act as a trusted advisor, delivering actionable insights and recommendations to clients across various sectors, including government and technology providers.
  • Publishing: Author and contribute to research papers, articles, and publications, enhancing Gartner's visibility as a thought leader in data center management and IT infrastructure trends.
  • Presentations and Conferences: Serve as a keynote speaker at industry events, webinars, and client meetings, engaging with key stakeholders and leading projects such as conference chair for Gartner I&

O events.

What You Will Need:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or advanced degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 10 years of experience, with significant expertise in data center industry standards, design, operations, trends and strategies, cloud strategies, and IT infrastructure.
  • Strong blend of technical and business skills, with a track record of advising executives and leading strategic projects.
  • Excellent analytical and research skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience as a keynote speaker.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
  • Track record of thought leadership through publications, presentations, and contributions to the data center and IT infrastructure community.

Certifications:

  • Relevant certifications, such as Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), Certified Data Center Management Professional (CDCMP), or others that validate expertise in data center technologies and practices are an asset.

What You Will Get:

  • Competitive salary, generous paid time off policy, charity match program, and more!
  • Group Medical Insurance, Parental Leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity.
  • Professional development and unlimited growth opportunities

Who are we?

At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

What do we offer?

Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

Verrai coinvolto su progetti a livello nazionale ed internazionale di Digital Transformation attraverso varie tecnologie tra le quali Low Code, Intelligent Business Process Management, Artificial Intelligence e Robotic Process Automation.
Nello specifico verrai coinvolto nelle seguenti attivit√†:
Supporto a studio di fattibilit√†, raccolta e analisi dei macro-requisiti, disegno e interpretazione di flussi operativi e sviluppo di componenti applicativi
Utilizzo di una o pi√π piattaforme, come UiPath, BluePrism, Appian, Outsystems, Microsoft Power Platform

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una laurea, o sei un laureando, in discipline tecnico-scientifiche
Possiedi conoscenze di base di uno o pi√π linguaggi di programmazione software
Possiedi conoscenza di base dei database MySQL / SQL
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi ottime capacit√† relazionali e di problem solving, un forte orientamento al raggiungimento degli obiettivi e una personalit√† dinamica e proattiva.

Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni concrete che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will our Lighthouse team, within the Intelligent Automation service line that deals with Digital Transformation projects.
As an integral part of the Team you will be supported by senior colleagues and will be involved in all project phases, bringing an active contribution and working closely with the Client.

You will be involved on national and international Digital Transformation projects across various technologies including Low Code, Intelligent Business Process Management, Artificial Intelligence and Robotic Process Automation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:

supporting feasibility studies,which consist of the collection and analysis of macro requirements, the capacity for designing and interpreting operating flows and the development of software components
use of one or more platforms, such as UiPath, BluePrism, Appian, Outsystems, Microsoft Power Platform
production and updating of functional and technical documentation.
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if you:
are a graduate or nearing graduation in technical-scientific subjects
have basic knowledge of one or more software programming languages
have basic knowledge of communication methods with MySQL/MsSQL databases
are proficient in English, preferably with study/work experience abroad

you have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, a strong goal-oriented approach, and a dynamic and proactive personality, with a problem-solving attitude and resistance to stress, which allows you to work effectively both in a group and independently.
Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

    • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
    • Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
    • International mindset and innovative projects.
    • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.

    Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

    Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

    As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the concrete actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

    Join us!

    Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

    KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

KPMG Open Platform is our new innovative Hub based in Naples , created to develop service models and high-tech solutions for businesses and Public Administration. The areas of focus include Cyber Security, Program Management for large-scale transformation projects in the Public sector, Application Maintenance, and Managed Services.

By joining our Team , you will be involved in managing business transformation processes related to the maintenance and optimization of software developed internally by KPMG. You will work closely with colleagues who are experts in implementing advanced digital solutions for clients in the Financial Services sector, ensuring the operational efficiency of systems and effectively supporting business processes.
Specifically, you will be involved in the following activities:

Writing SQL queries for extracting and/or deleting data in databases

Drafting technical analyses of end-to-end processes and monitoring interfaces
Integrating data from different sources or systems, working on ETL processes
Delivering training sessions to corporate users
Supporting the solution release and Hypercare phase
Creating customized reports for users and performing data analyses to improve data quality

You have earned a diploma or a bachelor‚Äôs/master‚Äôs degree in a technical-scientific field

IT Business Analyst Intern - Financial Services
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation
Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to businesses to support them in transforming their business models, improving and digitizing processes, analyzing and managing risks, and providing assistance in extraordinary financial operations. Specifically, by joining the Enterprise Platform Team you will be involved in managing corporate change processes. Together with experienced colleagues, you will analyze the strategic requirements necessary to implement the best digital solutions available on the market for integrated process management.
In particular, you will be responsible for:
Analysing the business requirements via in-depth sessions and interviews with the company areas involved in the process at different times
designing the best solution for the client using standard, preconfigured or customised SAP solutions
functional and technical analyses of end-to-end processes
internal tests and with users of the software solution
support and provision of training to end users
supporting the project team during the release.
This team is present in the offices of Milan, Rome, Naples, Bologna, Turin.

You will be involved in national and international projects alongside highly qualified professionals and will work closely with our clients in the Financial Services sector, including banks, insurance companies, and investment firms
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Attributes
To be the ideal candidate, you should have:
A master's degree in business, engineering management or similar
Motivation to work in information technology with financial services clients (banks and insurance companies)
Excellent knowledge of English, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Excellent knowledge of the Office suite.
Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A stimulating and dynamic context that fosters creativity and teamwork.
A hybrid work model to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay up-to-date.
An international mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for every individual, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, and integrity: these are KPMG‚Äôs Values, which create an open environment for the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to reach their full potential. Thanks to our commitment to promoting an inclusive work environment, our Network has achieved the ISO 30415 certification, attesting to the compliance of our Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and the UNI PdR 125 certification, which confirms gender equality. Our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) ‚Äì summarizes all the concrete actions we are undertaking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Advanced Analytics Data Platform team for the development of data flows within the company's Data Platform and the distribution of integrated Artificial Intelligence solutions across all business areas.
At least 2 years of experience in the role
Familiarity with Apache Spark and the Hadoop ecosystem
Depending on seniority, the candidate will be responsible for one or more of the following activities:
Implementation of data consumption pipelines (export pipelines, APIs)
Basic knowledge of Bash and Unix operating systems
Familiarity with MongoDB and NoSQL databases
Experience with SQL Server and Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience in designing cloud-on-premise integration architectures
Expertise in database design, data access strategies and mechanisms, data security and integrity control, engineering services, and distributed systems
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid work opportunities
Continuous training on hard and soft skills
Annual gross salary commensurate with experience (40-45K)

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualit√†, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilit√† e la sostenibilit√† al centro del business. Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo di un Data Engineer che entrer√† a far parte del del team di Advanced Analytics Data Platform, per lo sviluppo dei flussi dati della Data Platform aziendale e la distribuzione di soluzioni integrate di Intelligenza Artificiale verso tutte le aree aziendali.


Requisiti:

  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza nel ruolo
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL
  • Conoscenza del linguaggio Python
  • Conoscenza del framework Apache Spark e dell‚Äôecosistema Hadoop
  • Conoscenza base di DevOps
